Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Anne T
Reviews.Content: Amazing, beautiful and perfect location. Rooms are very clean and had everything we needed. The roof terrace is perfect for a evening drink. Staff very helpful. Lots of shops and places to eat nearby and the metro is just round the corner. I will never stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to shops, restaurants, metro and short walk from eiffel tower. This is a amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Quarterback
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to be new or newly decorated, and everything was clean and tidy and it made me feel at home from the start. The lobby and bar are fresh in design. The room was small like everything in Paris but it was always nice to come back! Service was mostly very good, but a couple of sour faces were spotted at breakfast. I would give 5 stars without this, however I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth time a charm”
Reviews.Author: FleurdeFloride
Reviews.Content: Finished fourth stay at this delightful hotel -- a quiet and chic enclave in the 7th. It is superb in every respect and I don't plan to stay anywhere else on future trips. It is so stylish and everyone is extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms, while small, have a high level of comfort and the location is very quiet and convenient. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a fun neighborhood!!”
Reviews.Author: Deb C
Reviews.Content: The room super cool. Architecture and design were amazing. Room (we had a room with a seating area) was smaller than most rooms when compared to big name hotels. We were there for only one night out of a week long Paris vacation. This room/hotel is perfect for two nights give or take. Since they are small rooms, it may be a bit tight for a long-term stay. Overall customer service was good, hotel conditions were top notch; very clean, spotless, and location was a plus! I would def return to this hotel upon a future Paris vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: bubblensqueek
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a few days in Paris and Hotel 7 Eiffel certainly contributed to the fabulousness of it all. The design is cool but not cold with quirky touches. We stayed in an Open Space room on the 4th floor which was worth the extra euros. Its clever design and use of space make the room feel big. The comfy bed, fantastic shower, soft towels and linen all added to a happy stay. If you go, don't forget to pop up to the 5th floor terrace for an aperitif - its a gorgeous little quirky space which is heated when its cold with blankets provided for extra warmth and cosiness. We only had breakfast at the hotel once. It was good but slightly overpriced and served by a lady who I think must have had a bad day in the office....The hotel is located in a residential area with plenty of alternative breakfast options around including Bar du central which is perfect for a lazy Sunday brunch.....Brasserie Thoumieux is just around the corner and not to be missed. All in all, absolute bliss!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: sawdy1066
Reviews.Content: Hotel 7 Eiffel is a lovey, modern hotel. The rooms are slightly larger than other European hotel rooms that we have stayed in (although not big by any means) and are spotlessly clean. The bed is also unbelievably comfortable (even for a pregnant woman!) and they are very accomodating with providing extra pillows! There is just a curtain to seperate the bathroom and bedroom so don't go there with anyone that you don't feel quite comfortable with as you might see more than you bargained for....! Breakfast was not fantastic and served by a woman who seemed to be scowling the whole time, but if you are in a rush in the morning it is adequate, although overpriced at 10euros for a croissant, some bread and a juice. The location is great, it was just a stroll from the Eiffel Tower and lots of other attractions, although we got a tourist bus from infront of the tower to see the rest of Paris. There are lots of shops and bars and bistros in the area with plenty of choice for eating out and shopping. It is a more residential area than a bustling tourist area, which was nice. Overall it was a great hotel and one of the comfiest rooms I have stayed in. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “7 Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: JamesLachlan
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel via the Eurostar website and got a very good rate. I was very happy with the room and the service offered by the hotel. My only complaint was that the pillows in the room weren't to my taste but this is a picky point and simply a reflection of me being fussy!! The quality of the furnishings and fittings was extremely high and very chic! When I am next in Paris I would stay here again. Highly recommended - I suggest you book!!

Reviews.Title: “GROSS.....THE WORST HOTEL EVER!”
Reviews.Author: virgo2408
Reviews.Content: When I took a shower in the "bathroom" (which consisted of a toilet and a tile floor with a hole in the floor) the water didn't go down the drain. Instead, I had to stand in inches of dirty water which flooded the whole bathroom. On our way out we alerted the receptionist and were told he would send someone up to deal with the issue. When we got back to the hotel the receptionist informed us that the shower was "clean" but that the water was going down slowly. We asked whether we could move to another room but were told that the hotel was full and that there was nothing he could do about our problem. He offered no solution and no apology. After asking for a manager we were told that there was no one available until the morning. We tried the shower again and ended up with a flooded bathroom and were forced to put towels all over the bathroom floor so that we could use the toilet overnight. The bathroom was so badly flooded that we had to stand in water while using the toilet. The following morning we complained to the concierge and requested a full refund and were repeatedly told that a refund was impossible as the room was given to us at a discounted rate. We were then informed that the receptionist who had dealt with us the night before was a temp who had no knowledge about hotel policy. When we asked the concierge for the manager she informed us that there was no manager available until the following Monday. After it was clear that we would not let the issue rest, a man behind the reception suddenly intervened in the conversation and assumed a position of authority. We then asked whether he was the manager and were told that he was the "deputy manager" and that the concierge was referring to the official title when she said there was no manager available. (Clearly the hotel policy is to deny the existence of a manager unless absolutely necessary.) We argued with the "deputy manager" for over 30 minutes. He placed a constant emphasis on the discounted rate of the room as though this was an excuse for them to avoid compensating us for our inconvenience. Finally, we were offered a 20 euro breakfast and drinks at the bar. After informing the "deputy manager" that this was not acceptable we were offered a 10% refund. We were rushing to catch a train so didn't have time to argue about the issue any further. In the end we received 16.50 EUROS for having to stand in dirty water while showering!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Salil S
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time here. Staff was very helpful. A number of great restaurants within walking distance from the hotel. Multiple very affordable supermarkets nearby for picking up supplies on the way out for day trips. Very convenient to various forms of transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BigDunk100
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in Hotel 7 Eiffel with my wife and some very good friends. The location was excellent and the staff very attentive. The bed was extremely comfortable. Our rooms were very clean although quite small. The shower/toilet area was not very big, but some very creative use of mirrors helped to create a bigger visual space. I would certainly recommend this hotel, it's as a good base for a short city break, but room size might have been an issue had we been based there for a longer period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on a great location”
Reviews.Author: LeticiaSD
Reviews.Content: The best about this hotel is its location. Very near metro and near restaurants and brasseries. The room I stayed was extremely clean, well appointed and new. Was a really nice stay!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Horndon on the Hill, England, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JTree70
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in Feb. 2012 and booked directly through the hotel website. The hotel is in an location which is easy to explore Paris - right next to the Metro although we walked with ease to the Eiffel Tower and Louvre. Room clean and stylish, as is the entire hotel. Staff friendly and spoke excellent English for those not at ease with French. We ate at a nearby restaurant called Di Michele which was superb. The hotel's breakfast was great too! Would definitely recommend the hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jodo136
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Staff very helpful and organised early check so room was ready at midday when we arrived Great location, within walking distance of Saint Germain, Musee D'Orsay, Eiffel tower etc. Plenty of cafes and restaurants close by (Rue Cler) Would get one of the larger rooms as like most hotels in Paris, the standard rooms are quite small Perfect base for exploring Paris

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: Ricewood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 7eiffel hotel for 6 nights, the staffs are polite and helpful. The location is perfect for business or tourist, it is close to both RER and metro station. We sometimes even walk to the tourist spots on the opposite side of the river. We had a standard city view, the room is a bit small, however the shower is good and bed comfy. We will consider 7eiffel in our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dresswalla
Reviews.Content: Everything wonderful about the hotel..............the location................the rooms ( though small but well appointed) ............the staff. Take a room on the top floor, as the hotel terrace is just opposite and you can use the beautifully designed terrace as your own.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: o t
Reviews.Content: What more can you say than an absolute Gem!!! The hotel is perfectly positioned only 5mins walk from the Eiffel Tower in a really pretty, quiet area of the city with plenty of restaurants nearby. The hotels a very cute boutique and has everything you need for a romantic long weekend! The rooms are perfect and the beds are the best weâ€™ve ever slept in!!! Also the hotel has an amazing roof top terrace where we enjoyed a drink every night!! Definitely stay here, you wonâ€™t be disappointed and me my gf canâ€™t wait to come back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Christmas Gem”
Reviews.Author: Lesley O
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults and 2 children) spent Christmas 2011 at Hotel 7 Eiffel and had the most beautiful Parisian experience. The hotel's location, the staff and the ambiance of the hotel were simply fabulous. The receptionist helpfully suggested where I could acquire a Christmas Tree for our room for my two children and they were enchanted on returning from their sightseeing to find that we had a tree ready for Santa to leave gifts. Within easy walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and some gorgeous cafes. This funky hotel has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Business stay”
Reviews.Author: Armando F
Reviews.Content: Good location with fair price. Rooms are nice and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: juliemaya
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early November with a friend and we both really loved our experience at the hotel. This was my third trip to Paris and, by far, this was my favorite hotel -- which stemmed from a combination of its location, the size and boutique hotel vibe, the laid back atmosphere, the price, and the well appointed rooms. There is also a great roof deck on the top floor, which is a perfect spot for coffee or a glass of wine and was a huge amenity for us. We really enjoyed that space and it was a great retreat at the end of a long day, as well as a relaxed location to start the day with a cup of coffee while we planned our adventures. As others have mentioned, the hotel is very modern in decor. The rooms are small, but very efficient with their use of space -- one of the most efficient I've ever experienced, in fact! There are mirrors everywhere, so the room feels open and light even though it is small. The bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was lovely and the shower was great. In addition to being super stylish, it was also incredibly clean. As much as we loved the room, I have one word of caution -- there is not much separation from the bedroom to the bathroom. There is a semi-transparent curtain that separates the bedroom from the sink and shower area. My friend and I took shifts to the roof deck with our coffee in the mornings so the other person could have some privacy while getting ready. I'm not quite sure how we would have made it work otherwise. It wouldn't be a problem for couples, unless you are on different schedules and have an early riser (or are super shy). The location is excellent. It is on a quiet street, but less than a block from a string of great restaurants and shops. It's very close to the Invalides, the Seine, and the Eiffel Tower; we walked from here all over Paris and found it very convenient. I've stayed in other parts of Paris in the past and this was my favorite location. You aren't stuck in the middle of the most touristy parts of Paris with high-priced, mediocre food, nor are you in a purely residential or business area where everything is closed by 6pm. It was the perfect mix and it was lovely to be able to walk down the street for breakfast or dinner and have so many options nearby. There are also some great boutiques. Our favorite meals in the neighborhood were Les Cocottes de Constant (more affordable and casual) and the fancier (and more expensive) Le Violon d'Ingres. Both were amazing and both are owned by the former-chef of the Crillon and Ritz, Christian Constant. If you are foodie, you must check them out: http://www.maisonconstant.com/eng_home.htm. And by all means stay away from the touristy restaurants on the Trocadero and Rue Rivoli. You'll spend a fortune and walk away wondering what all the fuss is about Parisian cuisine... I know I did on our first two trips!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to explore the city of light and love.”
Reviews.Author: hfuchs
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located perfectly. The price is quite high for the size of the rooms, but then again, it's Paris and we where there for the new years celebration. Very nice staff, extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “a place to return to”
Reviews.Author: georgemocha
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent four nights here in mid-December - a wonderful time to visit Paris. Streets and shopwindows are sparkling. The hotel is very stylish, super-clean (!!! - I'm neurotic), bathroom excellent. The toilet (high quality Duravit fittings) is private, and the sink and shower are separated from the room by a curtain. The room is very small but it works perfectly. The bed was great with nice quality fresh linens. The lighting is very good. The front desk staff was a high point with respect to friendliness and helpfulness. The street is quiet and the neighborhood is wonderful - convenience, charm, nearby Rue Cler markets, wonderful patisseries, boulangeries, restaurants, nearby metro, Eiffel Tower a few minutes away on foot. Both the quartier and the hotel require return visits as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, central, a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: FLAvour
Reviews.Content: I've spent 4 nights in this hotel and I liked it, it was the kind of hotel I was looking for. Beautiful dÃ©cor, cozy and chic atmosphere at the bar, and located close to many restaurant and pastry shops, at walking distance from many attractions like Tour Eiffel, Louvre, Champs ElisÃ©es. Staff at the reception desk is helpful should you need a map of the city, a taxi or a restaurant, but among those kind people I also met two or three employee (mostly at the bar) who were really unpleasant. Breakfast has a very good quality, as tea time: you can find Nespresso coffee, Damman tea selection, and delicious pastry and viennoiserie; some of their prices are ridiculous though, as I paid six euros for a single glass of sparkling water (served without the bottle, just the glass). I booked a city room and it is not different from the pics you can see on their website; I found it a bit too small and, what's worse, without a door dividing the bathroom from the bedroom, as there's only a curtain, so go there with someone you're very intimate to. The best part of the room was the gorgeous shower, powerful hot water to wake you up in the morning :) Even though I liked the hotel, there are some disappointing aspects, so maybe next time I'll try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iakovos
Reviews.Content: 7Eiffel has been recently rennovated and is a real beauty. We stayed here for a whole week and we had no problems at all. The standard double rooms are so small but not inconvinient. They are modernly decorated, with mirrors everywhere and a fanastic shower!!!, which is almost one with the rest of the room. But if you are planning to stay with someone and have a privacy issue this is not for you cause as said shower and toilet are not completly isoleted from the bedroom... The staff at the desk was wery helpfull and booked us a shuttle for the hotel. The rest of the staff alsoreally great. Room was cleaned every day. Wifi was open access all over the hotel. Location was excellent, just a few minutes from metro station (which is the best way to go around) and 10 min from Eiffel tower. Theres a beautifull tarrace at the top also.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Anna J
Reviews.Content: Even thou we spent only one night in this hotel i would recommend it to everyone!!! Fantastic location, very friendly and helpfule staff and very clean, comfi and modern room. Just perfect place to stay in Paris!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: MrBenagain
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of nights here in November and loved it. Managed to check in around 12.00pm so after a quick change went out and about exploring. Located in a nice quiet street with the Eiffel Tower approx 10 min walk away and the Louvre approx 20 min walk away. Managed to get a really good rate with breakfast included, plenty to eat and drink and all very fresh. Room was clean and well maintained, great shower and comfy bed, don't need much more than that. Plenty of little cafÃ©'s around for soaking up the atmosphere if required during the day and lots of them doing evening meals. Roof top bar was empty both nights we returned to the hotel and they have blankets to keep you warm if needed but heaters were on so did not feel the cold. Highly recommended if you want a small boutique style hotel that feels fresh and new.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: Stephw33
Reviews.Content: Even though the rooms are quite small, they are set up wonderfully. Very trendy and modern. Location was fantastic and service was great. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique :o)”
Reviews.Author: Shooba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights, the staff were extremely helpful, kind, respectful and polite. We were upgraded rooms free of charge on arrival, which was good, making the stay better value for money. Room service was delicious. We were able to store bags until we left for the airport despite the room reservation ending at 12. Which was extremely useful to us. The hotel itself is beautiful, very stylish, modern and fun :o) Where the hotel is situated limits the views from the rooms, however the rooms make the best out of them. We wish it would have been warmer on our stay, so we could have enjoyed the outdoor terrace, which is lovely. We would recommend this hotel. We had a fantastic romantic trip to Paris, the staff and hotel played an important part in this. Thank you :o) Oh... and the bed was so comfy it was heaven!! :o)

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice and clean room”
Reviews.Author: Dany D
Reviews.Content: the 7 EIffel hotel is nicely located just 5 minutes walk from a metro stop and about 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower. There are so many patisseries and boulangeries (as well as a Starbucks) just around the corner and the area is very quiet. We were given a very nice room, modern and comfortable, and always perfectly clean. I would really racommend it for a nice romantic stay in a modern hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, recently refurbed hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: 1MD
Reviews.Content: only criticism is that the room's window allowed a bit of noise in. very little traffic though so not such an issue. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Life-changing trip to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: StyleTravellor
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely faultless! I've stayed in many hotels around the world,from budget to luxurious. I honestly cannot say enough good things about this hotel. My boyfriend proposed to me at the top of the Eiffel Tower,and the hotel added to the wonderful experience that was Paris. The staff were lovely and extremely helpful, especially the two night porters that we came across. Everything from the lobby to our room was perfect and the garden terrace at the top is defintely worth a look. The room was extremely clean,the bed really comfortable and the shower amazing! Also in a perfect location,a short walk to the Eiffel Tower and right beside the metro,the easiest way to travel in Paris. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Chic but cosy comfort in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: Egemege
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Eiffel a second time after my satisfactory stay in June. I was happy with the hotel both times. I like the funky design of the hotel which manages to be harmonious with the historic character of its urban surroundings, the efficient service and amenities, and the express breakfast with fresh grapefruit juice! It is a luxury hotel but not over the top. Merci!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE 7 EIFFEL HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Ester L
Reviews.Content: The pictures I saw on the website were true to the hotel when I got there. The hotel was in great location, the staff was friendly and helpful, I loved the room, I loved the hotel! I definitely want to go back to 7 Eiffel when I return to Paris, and will recommend to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Neil from London”
Reviews.Author: Neil G
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is situated in a charming quiet street near to the Hotel des Invalides. The decor is stylish and the hotel is spotlessly clean. The staff are extremely efficient and attentive. The only slight disappointment was that the minibar in the room was inadequately stocked. the rooms are not cheap but, all in all, however, I would highly recommend this as a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel, fantastic location and good deals available!”
Reviews.Author: BinkleMM
Reviews.Content: It is really difficult to find a hotel in Paris... there are SO many and they all seem pretty expensive! I found Eiffel 7 researching online and liked the look of it. They had a special promotion available via their website where advance bookings made significant savings. The hotel was easy to find and staff were great on arrival. It is quite a small hotel but very clean and modern. The room was much bigger than I had expected for Paris with a fair sized en suite and seperate loo.The bed was extremely comfortable! We had a drink in the bar before our evening out and service was impeccable (yes - of course the drinks were expensive - we were in Paris!). Location is brilliant for getting to the Eiffel Tower and wandering around in the evening. Lots of bars and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Modern design in great location”
Reviews.Author: PaulArts
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel in a quite street near Invalides and Eiffel parc. We were lucky enough to find a parking spot in the street. Parking is free during the weekends. Rooms are not as small as we expected. Very well designed and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL ON EARTH”
Reviews.Author: tricialitzinger
Reviews.Content: I visited Paris in May with one of my best friends from London. The design of the hotel room was modern. The room was exceptionally large, even by US standards. The bathroom was large and luxurious with every detail well thought out. The beds were SUPERBLY comfortable cradling you so tenderly that sleep just enveloped your entire being, making getting out of bed difficult....quite a feat when in Paris! The lobby was small and basic but frankly but the eating area was ample and the chic boutique design was lovely. One of the best parts of this hotel- A SMALL HIDDEN ECLECTICALLY DECORATED ROOFTOP TERRACE!! Not much of a view but somehow you feel like youre in a little vibrant spot known only by you. A few negatives- Worse part is getting there from the airport. Taxis are expensive and I would not recommend finding the hotel alone if you have bags...its just too far and the steps for the metro would inhibit this option. Another downside is some of the staff. They could be friendlier. I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL OVER ANY OTHER I HAVE EVER VISITED :)

Reviews.Title: “Adorable Gem in a fabulous neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah C
Reviews.Content: We loved 7 Eiffel. Staff were helpful and friendly. Room was cozy, clean and funky. Area of Paris made me feel like a local - if just for a few days. The rooftop patio was perfect for enjoying fresh air and a bottle of wine. And there is a fantastic Creperie across the street that is not to be missed! I had booked this trip through a Eurostar package and got excellent value for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miss A
Reviews.Content: Hotel in great location, very close to metro and walking distance to eiffel tower! The area is full of cafes and shops, even a Starbucks and small supermarket at end of street. Staff were friendly and very helpful,got upgraded a slightly larger room with a balcony. Hotel has decent rates if you book in advance, this one is definately reasonable and worth it if you are sightseeing or even on a business trip and want a room with a bit of luxury and comfort. Room was clean and very modern with lots of neat touches to the room. Free Wifi was very useful and easy to connect to, and the ipod docking station. overall would definately recommend hotel!

Reviews.Title: “City of Love - but hearing your neighbours at it is extreme”
Reviews.Author: Aura K
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 5th floor next to the lift and terrace. The room was small but neat and modern. One problem we did have was rather cringeworthy - we could hear other guests having loud sex through the extractor vent in the bathroom of our room and as the rooms are small the sound carried across the whole room, leaving nowhere for us to go to escape it. When we complained to the receptionist - they offered to move us, but as we had only one night left and wanted to sight see instead of move rooms - we stayed put! Luckily by staying out late the next night we seemed to have missed the neighbours action the second night. Otherwise it was in a nice quiet location and just a short walk from the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best boutique hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: zwon3000
Reviews.Content: The hubby and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. Loved the quiet street it is on.The detail and attention of the design and equipment of the rooms and the communal areas is unmatchable. Very modern and clean and we got a very good price for our room. Paris rooms are usually tiny, however this hotel makes excellent use of the space provided. The room felt comfortable and not crowded at all. The terrace on the 5th floor is like a little piece of relaxation heaven. It is within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and we had breakfast in the park overlooking the tower every morning befrore we went on about our day, which I considered an added bonus. Cannot say enough good things about the hotel. We travel 6-10 times a year and have stayed in a lot of hotels in various cities around the world. I would not consider staying anywhere else in Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Scoom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, being but a few minutes from the superb Eiffel Tower! The hotel was not what you would normally expect but nonetheless the unique decor added to the fun experience particualry the lift! The staff were very friendly and helpful and engaged in pleasant conversation. The room was comfortable and very clean the decor was unusual but what you would expect from a boutique hotel. The roof garden was a particulay nice surprise however there was no view of the Eiffel Tower without getting on someones shoulders, but this did not detract from the experience. A great hotel in a great location in a great city!

Reviews.Title: “excellent place!”
Reviews.Author: hyun1023
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights in Le 7 eiffel Hotel. I chose 'Open space' with mini balcony. It was smaller than I thought, but clean and morden. Everyday the bed sheet is changed, the room is always clean when I came back. Metro, Supermarket, Eiffel Tower is near the Hotel. For me it is perfect, because the town was quiet. So I can fully take a rest in hotel. I hope the price will be cheaper than present!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: RREALM
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband chose 7Eiffel in paris, we got a good price, we like boutique hotels, and the location was important too. We were not disappointed at all!!! The hotel decor is awesome!!! the rooms are well equipped, although small.... shower size is adequate, and it's separate from the toilette and the sink. Everything was extremely clean, which I appreciated a lot!!! It's a good choice for couples but not for a family trip. The location is excellent, you have a metro stop a few blocks away, restaurants and shops are right around the corner. The bar area decor is really trendy. The bartender and the front desk crew were really nice to us, and exceeded our expectations!!! I will definitely stay there again!!! But not in October, Paris is too cold for us.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience for the price”
Reviews.Author: cityline_moscou
Reviews.Content: I agree with nearly all the good points mentioned in other reviews, especially the modern design and meticulous attention to detail in fittings, cleanliness, fantastic sleep quality, nice location and more or less adequate room size. No balcony though in my case. On the downside are a few things that I would not expect though. First, I was surprised to not find a reasonably giving light window, instead there was a narrow corner window covered by drapes, so you had to have your lights even on the brightest sunny morning. To be fair, I should add that the lightning equipment was more than sufficient. Another surprising element was their breakfast. For the 19 Euro price you only get a juice, a yogurt, a few pastries and coffee with milk. Nothing else. Moreover, when I asked to bring the breakfast to my room and add an egg, they refused and said it goes against their hygene rules... funny The toiletries did not include body milk, just a champoo and shower gel... for the class of the hotel it wants to be there must be more So all in all, I believe this hotel is a bit overpraized, and given the price/quality ratio it is a strong 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location, friendly staff, not overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Danjamin
Reviews.Content: The lobby sets the tone of the hotel from the moment you walk in, very modern & classy. The rooms follow in this tone, while not the biggest they serve their purpose perfectly. The staff are very friendly & quick to help with every request. The location of the hotel is perfect as it is a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel tower. Definitely worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “As advertised, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Djudd-07
Reviews.Content: Great place in Paris. Location, perfect, rooms, as pictured, service, top notch. Seven Eifel was everything we expected and more. Location was right near a metro stop, had killer restaurants and bars within walking distance and the service was second to none. You literally are in the heart of it all. Free wi-fi, great rooftop patio to enjoy a drink on, and the rooms were clean and well kept. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay right in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “!Warning! Don't expect 'the extra mile' here!”
Reviews.Author: Paul A
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very pleasant and the staff on arrival were very helpful....however a romantic stay was tainted by what I could only consider as terrible customer service. We requested an 'English Breakfast Tea' for the room, (yes a small ask!) only to be told that this was only possible if we ordered *two* 19 Euro breakfasts! I mean, come on, 300 Euros a night and you cannot meet a simple and polite request from your guests. No explanation, no apology given - "its our policy sir" Disgusting in my opinion. Look elsewhere, there's plenty of choice! Also, the rooms are small and sound insualtion from the street below is poor.

Reviews.Title: “My wonderful stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely, the room small but comfortable and really clean and great to stay in. The staff were all so friendly and the receptionist was extremly helpful and polite. amazing employee. location was amazing for young couple and perfect for viewing and going to all the major sites in Paris. just perfect

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Greta G
Reviews.Content: After a painstaking search for a hotel for our first trip to Paris, my husband and I decided on Eiffel 7 based on it's good reviews, "reasonable" price (for Paris standards) and good location, and we were not disappointed. I believe the hotel has only been open a few months so everything is fresh and new, although there are some interesting decorating choices (fake cobblestone carpet in the hallway, really?). The room was tiny (par for the course in Europe) But the room was very clean and the bed was awesome - a real double bed not the romance killing twin beds pushed together - with fluffy pillows and a plush duvet. The staff was friendly and very helpful and there is a bar downstairs although we never went. Another huge asset is the location - close to bus stops, metro and a cab stand - but even more so it's less than 2 blocks from Rue Cler, a fabulous street with a farmers market and great cafes and restaurants that are not very touristy and have such a wonderful neighborhood feel. Every morning we would walk here to get fresh croissants for breakfast - just awesome. The hotel is also a little over a half mile from the Eiffel tour and great parks. I would definitely stay here again, just awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Genious C
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris for the first time and it was our one year wedding anniversary. We picked this hotel because of the location, modern design, boutique and last price was reasonable for Paris. The hotel is beautiful!!! WE loved it and would recommend this to anyone. Our room was awesome..we even had view of the the Eiffel Tower. My only reason for giving it 4 stars was the reception we received when checking in was not very warm. He was not helpful and did not go out of his way to help us given it was our first time in Paris. For example, I asked for a map and most hotel personnel open it up and show you where the hotel is located and show where the highlights of the city are and so forth. We were just handed the map until I asked where the hotel is, etc. For the time in a foreign city, I was intimidated and worried rest of the French were like this. Thank goodness they were NOT.

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mark f
Reviews.Content: i won this hotel part of a prize to see britney spears!!! it was the most beautifulist boutique i have stayed in the whole staff we very warm and inviting and was very helpful all while i was there, i am definetly going to stay there again and highly recommend to everyone , its very quaint and easy to get to the eiffell towers and u defo need to stay there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Stay”
Reviews.Author: ParanoidPlanner
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel due to its location and also due to the other reviews here on TA. The pictures on the website are exactly like what the rooms are like in real life. The staff is super courteous and helpful. The location is excellent, 5 minute walk to the nearest subway station and from there all the major tourist sites are a short ride away. Highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be coming back the next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect weekend made even more perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Carly R
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris for our Honeymoon and my wife's 30th Birthday. Having read the reviews I was hoping the hotel would be something special for the occasion, I could not have been more right. On arrival we were greeted by a lovely lady at reception who spoke good enough English for my very poor French, our room was perfect and we found that we were in a lovely quiet area in arms reach of the Eiffel Tower and the river. Spent three nights at the hotel and the staff could not help enough with requests that we made. The are that it is located in is first class and for the price you could not be any closer to the best area in Paris. Will certainly be heading back there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling”
Reviews.Author: Art_Travel01
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay for 3 nights. The rooms are small, but well designed and spotless. The public spaces (lobby, bar/breakfast area, and rooftop lounge) are modern, comfortable and fun. If you want to stay on the left bank in the Invalides/Tour Eiffel area, this is are great choice. Two blocks from Rue Cler, it also has lots of excellent restaurants and shops in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Paris Break”
Reviews.Author: dawn h
Reviews.Content: i took my boyfriend to Paris for his 21st. We stayed at Hotel 7 Eiffiel and it was brilliant. Very clean, spacious and modern. It was in a nice location with bars and cafes nearby and just around the corner was the eiffel tower. There was also a metro closeby which connected to invalides - from there you can easily get to anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, contemporary, and close to local Paris fanfare”
Reviews.Author: Kev L
Reviews.Content: 7 Eiffel was a joy to stay in, its located in the Invalides region and is a few blocks away from street vendors, local eateries, supermarkets, the metro, and the eiffel tower. the hotel was very clean, and the bed/sheets/pillows were super soft and comfy. The maid servicing schedule was kind of strange though, as they were trying to service the room at 9AM, and 10AM during the weekend.... location was fantastic, as the hotel was located a block away from the Rue Cler market place - with local parisan cuisine and shops, it was a delight to walk through every day. -kev

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel, Staff Friendly and highly competent”
Reviews.Author: Nicolas O
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location. Its staff is very friendly and highly competent. The room was slightly on the small side (as often in Paris) but very comfortable (with a very comfortable bed). Nice design bathroom. Everything in the hotel was extremely clean. Have been welcome with a voucher for two complimentary glasses of Champagne on the very nice bar on the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Unique”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_KR
Reviews.Content: Nice modern rooms, typically on the small side but arenâ€™t all rooms in Paris. Great location near metro, however this line is not the most convenient. Saying that, you can walk to many Paris highlights. Nice quite little side street despite the central location. Right near Rue Cler which is a great little market street. Only small disappointment â€“ we had purchased fantastic items at the market and wanted to sit on the terrace and enjoy them but were told we were not allowed to consume our own food on the terrace. The other thing to consider, if you are staying on the terrace level, people can smoke there. So you can smokeâ€¦ but you canâ€™t eat!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: grahamheddle
Reviews.Content: A super, small hotel with expertly designed rooms to maximise space and nice design touches. Very friendly staff in both English and French in an excellent location. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Isabelle010779
Reviews.Content: Perfect Hotel! Located right near the metro station. Great location to walk to some major points of interest such as the Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysee, Arc de Triomphe.... Staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and really well decorated. Bed was comfortable. Free Wifi available as well. I would highly recommend this hotel and plan on returning there myself one day!

Reviews.Title: “Cute, funky, and friendly”
Reviews.Author: sologirltraveler
Reviews.Content: I met a girlfriend here for a few days in Paris, and chose this hotel using TripAdvisor. GREAT great great location! Walking distance to so many things including Napoleon's tomb, Eiffel Tower, and great shops and restaurants. Also close to a Metro stop. The hotel was very cute and friendly, reasonably priced, spotlessly clean, and trendy cool. Our room was really small but we weren't in it much anyway. It probably would be a bit too tight for longer than a few days' stay. They had a cute roof deck but we made more use of the lobby bar each afternoon - was nice to come in the door after a day of sightseeing and shopping and plop down on the couches with a glass of wine. Our only complaint was there was a weird smell in the vents--when you turned on the A/C it smelled like a dead rat; swear to God, but it seemed to dissipate by the third day. Staff was reasonably friendly and helpful and spoke pretty good English.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little gem!”
Reviews.Author: ninahje
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny, but that's the case for most hotels in Paris, so that's no big deal. The staff are all excellent, accommodating and friendly. The hotel is full of exiting interior and art, do try the rooftop patio!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in lovely environment”
Reviews.Author: kvi001
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in the 7Eiffel last August (5-7 Aug 2011) and it was the best hotel we ever had in Paris. The reception staff were very friendly, the room was nice and cosy, the carpet on the floor hilarious (cobblestone -look). The "rain" shower very refreshing after our long walks in the streets of Paris. The neighbourhood is very safe and quiet but still close to many patissiers and restaurants. When you're there, try the Bellota Bellota restaurant (it's very close) where you can eat some of the best hams in the world, pata negra, jabugo etc. The hot dishes are excellent as well. We loved our stay here so would certainly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: rsthomas11
Reviews.Content: I celebrated a great 30th birthday weekend here. It is in an ideal location to explore Paris - we bought a 5 day travel card for â‚¬30 (covering zones 1-3) and we used this extensively to see all the popular sites. The staff were really friendly and spoke good English. The room was quite small but big enough for a couple for a weekend stay. Lots of mirrors and different lighting in the room too which made the room feel bigger. Room had a separate toilet and shower but the sink/clear shower cubicle was only separated by a semi-transparent curtain (again fine for couples). Our room was on the 1st floor and although the hotel is on a quiet side street it was sometimes noisy early morning. Maid service was excellent, room was tidied/cleaned daily - a welcome sight after a day on your feet! A free bottle of water is provided daily too. Like "Cheremuha", I also told the hotel about my birthday in advance but no mention or upgrade was offered (would have been a nice final touch). Roof terrace was great but you had to buy food/drink from the hotel which were quite expensive - breakfast was â‚¬19 so we preferred to go out to eat. The local area was filled with bakeries, cafes & restaurants of all origins so not a problem. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel and would love to go back to stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden boutique hotel gem”
Reviews.Author: Zorro7770
Reviews.Content: The 7 Eiffel is only a short walk away from the Eiffel Tower. No matter which direction you turn - there are lots of butchers, bakeries, cheesemongers and fantastic little local restaurants. Even in the same street! My room's been small, but lovely designed - very functional and each corner, drawer or shelf is thought through. The bathroom is petite, so I reckon this being the perfect room for a single traveller on business. The location itself is fabulous. The little lounge is very welcoming with its goldfish glass, and the furniture is pretty and minimalist, same time comfy. The most amazing thing's the outdoor space behind the bar - very futuristic, all white and featuring power sockets for laptop workers. Hosted a small meeting with colleagues on their rooftop. Perfect place for private conversations! ...the hotel room's are really offering everything you'd be asking for on a biz trip (or when you're on a mini trip). BTW it's immaculate - never stayed in such a clean and spotless room in France before! It couldn't get better than that! Would always go back. PS. The reception staff is super friendly!

Reviews.Title: “la vie en roses!”
Reviews.Author: Cheremuha
Reviews.Content: My husband booked the hotel in advance and made a good deal. The hotel is VERY clean. The maids know their job (many thanks to them!!). Beds and pillows are just wonderful!! The stuff is very friendly. Our email to the hotel before the trip was replied very quickly. There is only one BUT. My husband warned the hotel by email that I would have birthday on the arrival date. Unfortunately the reservation department did not make a reservation alert regarding my birthday and noone from the stuff congratulated me. But this did not spoil my opinion of the hotel itself. The professional hotel photos do not lie and show the hotel rooms as they are. Location is perfect! We did not have breakfast as there are plenty of small cafes nearby. The receptionists suggested to contact the hotel directly for future trips as there are many promotion rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great interiors, fantastic location, helpful staff - strongly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: HBDXB
Reviews.Content: Both my wife and I had a great stay at this hotel. Strongly recommend it. Only negative was that rooms were a bit small - but that's Paris I guess!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy F
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay at 7 Eiffel Hotel in Paris. It was an awesome location, very central and surrounded by wonderful cafes and restaurants. The hotel wasa gorgeous! Clean and inviting. The staff was pleasant and very accomodating. We had a wonderful experience and would definately stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, fantastic location, helpful friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: HJay75
Reviews.Content: A beautiful room with clouds painted on the ceiling, stylish lights everywhere and an iPod alarm clock dock which was playing calming music on arrival. The large double bed, albeit two singles pushed together, was very comfortable. It was made up so you could hardly tell, with lovely soft sheets. There was a proper hairdryer, with different speed setting, and there was a fantastic magnifying light-up mirror in the bathroom, ideal for make-up application. There was only one set of towels in the bathroom, but we never got around to asking for another one. There was also a free bottle of water and the most reasonably priced mini-bar I have ever encountered in a hotel; it was cheaper than the local cafes. What was surprising was that price of the drinks served on the roof top terrace. They were much more expensive than the local cafes. However, the terrace was an oasis of calm, although it lacked a view, sadly, of the â€˜old ladyâ€™. The hotel is in a superb location for visiting Paris. The surrounding area is full of small shops, restaurants, bars and cafes, and so makes an ideal base for spending a few days in Paris. The hotel wins for location, price (we took advantage of a promotion) and style, and the friendly and efficient staff are quick to provide advice on matters Paris. I would definitely stay at the 7Eiffel again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL - VERY MODERN ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: waggy1971
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Trip Advisor search engine which suggested Thomas Cook as cheapest option which saved us a fortune on the hotels own rates. We arrived into Charles De Gaulle Airport and caught the RER (9 Euro each) into St Michael Metro Station (right at Notre-dame / Latin Quarter) and the Metro line then runs to 2 stations near to hotel Invalides or La Tour Maumbourg. Latter is closest only 5 min walk to hotel. Hotel is sitated in region 7 near Invalides and 5 min walk to Eiffel Tower. If you are looking for the nightlife buzz then I would suggest a hotel closer to Latin Quarter. There are numerous restaurants and bars in immediate area of hotel but it is located in a quiet street. On arrival we were met by fluent english speaking reception staff who were very helpful and friendly. We were allocated a room on the 1st floor. Room was quiet, very modern and pleasant inside. They were spotlessly cleaned every day by efficient maid service. Loved the shower and the bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept on. There is a complimentary safe and a mini bar (you can fit full size bottles of wine in it). Hotel bar prices are extortionate 14 Euros a cocktail and 10 - 12 Euro for a spirit. We needless to say bought a carry out for the room and drank elsewhere which was a pity as the bar and rooftop terrace are lovely. Plenty of supermarkets / off sales and eateries in the area all reasonably priced. For best eating options and deals go to Latin Quarter where you can routinely get a 3 course meal for about 15 Euro per head (again alcohol quite expensive 7-60 a pint and about 5-6 Euiro for a small house white wine (nothing special). Hotel is about a 40 minute walk along Seine from Latin Quarter or you can get Metro or a bus. We loved the hotel and it was in a good location for us as we appreciated the option of a busy noisy night at LQ or a more subdued night in area of hotel Beware the Eastern European females looking for you to sign a petition or that "innocent" woman finding a brass ring on street all ploys to rob you of your property. We "politely" well not really politely - other end of spectrum told them we were not interested and to go away which worked after we saw a Japanese woman being robbed by the petition signers at Notre-dame (thankfully police grabbed them immediately). Tea / Coffe making facilities in room and hair dryer. Only downside was bar prices. Great city great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, well appointed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Birdwatcher33
Reviews.Content: We thought this was a fun and modern hotel. Everything was very new and the hotel website pictures were accurate to our experience. We had pleasant experiences with all of the front desk staff. Can't comment on the breakfast as we opted for the much cheaper street fare. Had no problems with wireless or of any kind really.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAFF GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Trev L
Reviews.Content: We stay twice at hotel over a week period as we had a wedding to go to elswhere in France, when we arrive hotel we very pleased to see hotel pictures match what we seen sometimes not always the case with other hotels. The staff we excellent more than helpfull with any thing you needed. The rooms we were in 104 on first stay was a little noisey at times in the morning but nothing to bad we later stayed in room 506 top floor which did not get any noise so all quiet, rooms were also kept spotless by house keeping with bedding change every day. The location was amazing too, come out of hotel turn right to bottom of the road then turn right eiffel tower in view and 5 minute walk and your there, turn left out of hotel take a right turn and next left you are at Rue Cler , great local resturants were you will not get ripped off and great shops to by your pic nic for the day and walk the Eiffel and relax , all in all GREAT STAFF GREAT LOCATION

Reviews.Title: “WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!”
Reviews.Author: MollyWelch
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a stay for my boss at this hotel. When speaking to someone at reception, they were RUDE, UNPROFESSIONAL, spoke TERRIBLE English, and proceeded to hang up on me after asking a few simple questions. They couldn't even properly confirm that a package I sent my boss had been successfully received. They said they had no way of checking. Further, they could not even help me arrange a car service transfer for my boss to and from the airport for her arrival and departure. They requested that I send the credit card details for payment via email. Yeh, like that is safe to do this day in age. Of course, I requested a credit card authorization form to be sent to me instead, and they had NO IDEA what I was even talking about. There is NO 24 hour management on site, so if you have any issues, please know that it will go COMPLETELY UNNOTICED until a Manager is available, which can be highly inconvenient for urgent matters. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone as I have had more problems with them than ANY other hotel I've worked with through out ALL of Europe. WORST EVER.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel that we'd love to return to”
Reviews.Author: Simon P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. All of the staff were lovely; particularly the ladies serving the delicious and filling breakfast! The hotel is in a great location, very close to the Eiffel Tower, easy access to walks along the river and very easy access to the Metro. The room had a lovely intimate feel, with brilliantly fitted ensuite, a huge comfortable bed and stylish appliances. The room was also peaceful and the climate control worked a treat. The hotel as a whole had great style and brilliant detailing that really made it an interesting place to stay. We will definitely use this hotel again when visiting Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good location ,very clean room. Good suggestion”
Reviews.Author: armvc
Reviews.Content: Near the eiffel tower in the centre of zone 1.The staff are very kind and helpful.Clean room with the best sleep quality i ever had. But the breakfast for 4 star hotel was very , very , very ,poor.

Reviews.Title: “We loved celebrating our honeymoon here!”
Reviews.Author: MrsFlr
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon here and loved it. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. We loved our stay here and would for sure consider staying here again next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined our first wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Arati21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay in this hotel for our first wedding anniversary based upon reviews we read here. We arrived late on our first night, and despite a wait, there was someone to check us in. Our first day was fine without any problems, but unfortunately, on the day of our departure (and the day of our actual anniversary), there was a problem with the hot water, which left the entire hotel without hot water. We had been soaked by the rain downpour the night before, and were both keen to take showers before we left. The hotel did not inform us about the lack of water. We had to discover this ourselves. Also, they were unable to inform us of when it would be fixed, and would not let us check out later to wait for hot water. I found their attitude very disappointing. While I understand that these things can happen, the hotel's attitude towards us could have been much, much better. Especially as I informed them that this was our first wedding anniversary. They left me in tears. They ruined this for us, and unfortunately spoiled what would otherwise have been an excellent trip.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, friendly staff, great location...”
Reviews.Author: edmondhusseini
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this trendy Parisian boutique hotel. We took advantage of the lovely rooftop terrace almost every day and the concierge's recommendation to dine at the nearby Cafe Constant was great. The hotel also arranged cabaret tickets for us, which was very convenient. I also want to publicly thank the night-time receptionist. I suffer from severe headaches and on one of the nights it was 4am and I could not fall asleep because I forgot to pack my pain-killers. I don't know his name but he was kind enough to come up to our room with some paracetamol, allowing me to enjoy another beautiful day in Paris the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: michkell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a couple loved everything about hotel such a great location and staff were excellent and professional at all times...would highly recommend hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Disappointing stay after such great reviews”
Reviews.Author: PaulN28
Reviews.Content: After reading the many good reviews on this and other sites we booked 7Eiffel for a romantic 2 night break last weekend. On arrival the hotel looked fabulous, great location modern contemporary interior we couldn't wait to get to our room to see more. When we arrived the check in desk was busy with another customer but nobody else was available to greet us and after 10 minutes left sitting there we had still not even been acknowledged. After finally checking in and being told breakfast would be included with our room we made our way up to our room on the 3rd floor only to find the key card to our room did not work so we returned to reception to ask them to check it ... this happened a further 3 times before we could even get in our room. Once in our room we were impressed with the contemporary interior although a little small we were only staying for 2 nights. That evening we stepped into the shower only to find that it completely flooded the rest of the bathroom and bedroom area, this happened everytime we showered and completely ruined the experience and resulted in my partner falling over one morning. When we checked out we told the receptionist this only to be told by her we know already and were in discussions with the arcitect! well if she knew already why not mention it ! We also found the quality of the complimentary bathroom products to be very poor. After this we continued to feel disappointed with this highly regarded hotel, the reception staff were unknowledgable and unhelpful, the bar does not open after 12.00, breakfast is very basic and very expensive (and was not included in our room as we had been told !) and there is no local information available on restaurants. e.t.c. One evening we asked the receptionist to book us a cab, when the cab arrived the receptionist rung us but we were already in the lift down to reception, we then got straight in the cab only to find that the cab was already at 12 euros when we questioned the cab driver we were told that they charge extra when booked via the hotel, even though the hotel had not mentioned this. When we mentioned this experience to the reception staff the next day they simply said that yes you pay extra, BUT 12 euros extra ! Also during our stay there was no food available through room service and as per previous reviews there are no shops locally to buy food. For a top reviewed new hotel we were left feeling very disappointed and missing some of the extras that other hotels of this standard would have.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Emma300
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and we are so glad we chose this hotel. It is extremely modern and beautifully decorated/ furnished. We had a standard room which wasn't overly big but the way it was decorated made it seem far bigger. The bathroom/ shower room was just stunning. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ridon1973
Reviews.Content: Having been to Paris on a number of occasions, we found the Eiffel 7 a great hotel, located in a good area for bars, restaurants and of course the Eiffel Tower only 7 minutes away. A word of warning look out for pickpockets and expensive beer in the capitals cafes and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect trip!”
Reviews.Author: Cherrypie810
Reviews.Content: Hotel was outstanding, nothing could be faulted. so modern and quirky, perfect for the younger generation. Staff were so friendly and helpful, every single member of staff spoke fluent English and always went out of their way to help. Would deffo stay here again, made the trip extra special. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “many good points for this tiny hotel”
Reviews.Author: nadineabc
Reviews.Content: New, modern, clean, good service and helpful staff. Had a basic room and was quite small but only there for one night so didn't really matter. Also shower only separated from main room by a curtained glass partition so if you like your privacy go for a different room!!! Hotel on a quiet side street and is overlooked (as with all inner city hotels!) but net curtains and blinds and black out curtains meant you could still have privacy and light then blackout at night. Very comfortable bed. Front desk kind enough (eventually!) to let us have a 1hr late check out even though they were very busy. Bar staff great in evening too when we wanted a late drink and there is a fantastic quiet roof terrace. Also very close to metro-3min walk- and taxi stand. Didn't have any food there so cant comment about that but did have on the breakfast which was basic and over priced at 19euros for a simple continental breakfast. Had commitments in Paris so no chance to explore immediate surrounding area but seemed to be cafes nearby and certainly many things a short walk/cab ride away. We booked quite late and got a discounted rate on the hotel website of around 180 euros for the night. I think it was still quite expensive for what it is but then I suppose most hotels in central Paris are so comparatively it was pretty reasonable. If you want a small, clean, quiet convenient, practical new boutique hotel that isnt too fancy but is completely appropriate for a few nights and also nicely decorated and kitted out then this is a good choice. I would recommend it and would definitely stay there again if another very short trip. If longer than a few nights i would probably prefer a bigger hotel with more facilities and bigger rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in perfect Paris location”
Reviews.Author: Slaynepies
Reviews.Content: Everything about Hotel 7Eiffel was perfect for an American tourist in Paris. The staff at the front desk was warm and gracious and quite happy to speak English. The room was fun, contemporary, and quite large - enough for a queen size bed, small table, and writing desk. The bathroom was clean and modern. The best part of the hotel was the perfect breakfast options. Guest could choose between a quick breakfast of croissants or pain au chocolat, juice and coffee, or a larger breakfast with eggs, fruit, etc. The location in the 7th was fantastic. A quiet street, but close to so many sites. I definitely will stay here again and highly recommend the Hotel 7eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location. Would love to stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Curlyourlashes
Reviews.Content: A short ten minute walk from the Eiffel tower and a few blocks away from the metro. Also located one street away from the rue de cler area known for it's local street food markets. Starbucks is around the corner for those who miss their American comforts. The hotel was modern and fun. We found our room to be very comfortable and enjoyed taking drinks on the patio with friends. Clean, smoke free and friendly staff. Breakfast was delicious but I would have preferred more variety like their other hotel in the St. Germain area, hotel 7. We had already been in Paris for two weeks so I was a little tired of just bread and yogurt and soft boiled eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: stor76
Reviews.Content: Modern boutique-hotel in good location - close to Tour Eiffel, Jardins des Invalides. Metro 3 Minutes away, "Rue Cler" with nice restaurants/Bistros/Boulangeries also nearby. Supermarkets around the corner. Room very small, but with stylish decor and large shower in white marble. Could have been a little cleaner when we arrived (candypaper on the floor, some hairs in the shower...), but improved the next day. Receptionists were nice and easy. Breakfast was good, but at EUR 19,-/Person somehow overpriced. Breakfast room/Bar also with stylish design, we liked it. Very nice service: big umbrellas provided in case of rain. Overall good experience, hence recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a wonderful Paris visit”
Reviews.Author: klaurie99
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to Paris for myself and my girlfriend. I chose this hotel based on beautiful pictures, affordable price and excellent reviews. Everything lived up to expectations and in many ways surpassed them. The location was superb, walking along la rue Saint-Dominique unfolds cafes and restaurants on nearly every picturesque street corner. In less than 10 minutes time you find yourself at the threshold of one the the world's most iconic landmarks. Or if you would prefer to save that experience for a later, head east and in a few moments you're at the footsteps of Les Invalides, and just a few minutes away from the beautiful Pont Alexandre III, after which crossing turn left to start your journey among so many Parisiens and tourists alike along the Champs-Elysses, or right towards what is probably the world's most famous museum. This basically is to say that the location of the hotel is fantastic and you don't need to take the metro or taxi to start a new day discovering Paris. When you are browsing through pictures of the property on websites, believe me, these photos are genuine. The lobby, bar, and restaurant are beautifully decorated with ultra modern decor which is just about as picture-perfect as you can get. If you have a chance to visit the rooftop terrace, enjoy a drink to end your day. The rooms are lovely, spotless, and space-efficient. Do not expect the most square footage as one must remember this is Paris, and Europe for that matter where space isn't always at the forefront of hotel engineering. Nonetheless, the 7 Eiffel appreciated the fact that a good nights sleep is often near the top of travellers lists, and the beds/pillows are probably one of the hotel's strongest assets. The staff of the 7 Eiffel is remarkable and always greeted us with a smile and did their best to accomodate us upon any request we had. They also speak english very well, not to worry. In summary, would I suggest this hotel for visitoirs to Paris? Definitely. With all of the positives, and virtually no negatives, it's hard to find a reason not to stay here when you visit the City of Lights.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Bliss”
Reviews.Author: ettlemae
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time in Paris at the Hotel & Eiffel. The room was beautiful. It was clean and had a great balcony. There was a litle street noise but nothing that interfered with our enjoyment of the room. The bonus was the glass of champagne for my new husband and I to enjoy (compliments of the management) with which to toast our new marriage. This was a very classy touch. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to splurge and enjoy a beautiful hotel in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great for romantic time with your loved one!”
Reviews.Author: Anushka_11
Reviews.Content: Positive: located in the center of Paris (7th district)- 7-10 min walk from Eiffel tower; 3 min from Invalids, 2 min from metro. Open space hotel room was quiet, full of mirrors, big and comfortable bed; see-through shower: great for lovemaking ;)! Free internet! The only negative moment, is that the room was rather small.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: timmoore1977
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my fiancee for her 30th birthday and we had a brilliant time - and being in Paris in the glorious July sun made it even better! I picked the hotel as it was recommended on a Guardian travel feature and after looking on the website I knew it was the one for me. I booked one of the Open Space rooms (which are the largest in the hotel) as they have an additional living area and a balcony. Upon arriving at the hotel I was immediately sure I'd made the right choice as it looked every bit as good as it did on the website (and not that many hotels can say that). The room was perfect in every way and excellent use was made of all the space available. The balcony faced on to the flats opposite, but it was great to be in the thick of Paris life. The room was spotlessly clean and the maid did a great day of making it up for our arrival (and for the days following). The bed was so comfortable and my finacee wanted to take the pillows home. All of the communal areas were wonderful too - I just wish I'd made better use of the roof garden (could have spent hours up there). The hotel is only 5 minutes walk from the Metro and only 10 minutes from the Eiffel Tower. It's in a great area with loads of shops, cafes and restaurants in the streets near by. If we hadn't been so keen to see all of Paris we could have happily spent our time in the hotel and the surrounding area. All of the staff were really friendly and being a non-French speaker wasn't a problem for them. All in all, a perfect stay. I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, chic, pleasurable experience”
Reviews.Author: Egemege
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the stay overall. Great design, mixing zen minimalism, art deco, and funky fabrics.. Kind of boutique, not historic but blending in nicely within the historic character of this area of town. Nice little touches like two complimentary champagne glasses, caramel sweets on the pillows, name tag of who made your bed.. The pillows were a little too puffed up for me, but the duvet was heavenly.. One receptionist on night duty was slightly rude, but otherwise all staff were pleasant. Clean and comfortable bedroom, no body lotion though so bring your own.. 2 minutes walking distance to Ecole Militaire metro station, and 15 minutes to UNESCO, where I had meetings for my business trip. I would recommend it highly as a charming boutique hotel located centrally in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels we've ever stayed at in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Jonmouk71
Reviews.Content: The room and accomodations were first rate. The staff was pleasant and helpful. We loved the location near the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel and will be going back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nickandkate27
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel and were delighted to hear we had been upgraded! The staff were very helpful with advise of where to go in Paris... The room was lovely and comfortable with no traffic noise as situated on a quiet street. The roof terrace was lovely and whenever myself and wife went to relax up there we were always on our own!! The hotel seemed brand new, with a real retro & funky feel! The room was fully airconditioned with free Wi Fi if needed. The bed was seriously comfy with a balcony over looking one of the surrounding streets. I would definetley recommend this hotel. A real gem!

Reviews.Title: “Average Review”
Reviews.Author: Sameer1980
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for 1 night. We arrived at the airport and the hotel had organized a shuttle to pick us up from the airport. After 3 phone calls to the hotel and waiting for 1.5 hours the shuttle arrived. We finally got to the hotel. While I was checking in, I asked the front desk where we could do a bit of shopping. The guy at the front desk said that all the shops were closed as it was a Sunday. Another couple who were checking out, interrupted and said that we should go to the Champs D Ellesey as all the shops were open. If it wasn't for them, we would have been sitting at the bar drinking (oops the Hotel Bar was closed on the Sunday as well). The hotel itself was great - no complaints - but for the price we had paid, I'm quite sure there are hotels with better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “A special hotel for a special weekend”
Reviews.Author: Gibby24
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and every part of the hotel was clean and beutifully designed. We arrived in the middle of the night to a very helpful receptionist who told us all we needed to know without us having to ask. A big thank you to him for opening our bottle of wine and the roof top terace in the early hours of the morning, where I proposed to my lovely lady. If I had to pick bad points I would say the cost of breakfast (19 euro), I dont know if it was worth it because I didn't try it. Also I had to prise information out of a day time receptionist about how to get to the airport. I wouldn't stay again simply because it is out of my usual price range but it was a special hotel for a special weekend.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING! My favorite hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: JoslinAnn
Reviews.Content: Everything from the decor to the service is 5 star. Lovely experience, wish I could have stayed more nights. Perfect area, breakfast is really good. Its the perfect boutique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Blown away - we love it - and will not stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: DandM7880
Reviews.Content: Everything is perfect! The rooms are amazing with stunning finishes and not to mention the bathrooms are exquisite! Our favorite part of this hotel is the Roof Terrace - where you can relax and order drinks and snack from the bar. The service is impeccable and the location is a stones throw away from the Eiffel Towel, stunning restaurants and shopping boutiques.

Reviews.Title: “A nice find...Beautiful design and well used space....”
Reviews.Author: CalEuroTraveller
Reviews.Content: The 7 Eiffel was as nice as its photos and then some. Paris hotel rooms are normally quite small, as was my room, but the space was very well-used. The use of mirrors also made it seem larger. The bathroom, with its very crisp modern design, was compact and modular, with a pocket door doubling as the full length mirror. The bed was very comfortable and the sitting area was quite nice. Two things I very much appreciated were the iPod dock and the free, very fast wifi available in the room. Paying for wifi in hotels is just not right. The staff was accommodating and attentive. The Express breakfast option for 8â‚¬ was nice. The rooftop was quite a lovely space, and I tried to have breakfast there one morning, but the bees had another idea. The location was excellent...close to the LaTour Maubourg Metro stop and the adjacent taxi stand. This hotel is very well run, in my opinion. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: apom83
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights and had a great time. It is a beautiful hotel in the bet location. Walk to the Eiffel Tower or Metro in 5 min. The rooftop patio was fun and relaxing and the service was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Adults Only - NOT so great with kids.”
Reviews.Author: NCFreddy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and it is about a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. As my title said, this is a great hotel for adults only. I traveled with my 12/13 yo daughter and the see through curtain to the shower is not appropriate. I asked the desk to switch it out with a solid curtain and got the we cannot do that. Seriously, $10 for a new plastic curtain and my rating would have been much better. Only other issue was they shut down the restaurant so they could do an underwear photo shoot. Again, not so appropriate for a 12/13 yo girl. I was more upset because I couldn't sit down to have a coffee. I had to go up to the 5th floor terrace. The hotel and the rooms were very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff & excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: TeriCanada
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel 7 Eiffel for a 3 night stay. The staff was most welcoming & always there to address any questions or needs that we had. We needed a converter, they lent us one. We asked for recommendations on restaurants, they provided great local ones. We required an airport transport, they coordinated it. If you are looking for a hotel that is very close to the Eiffel Tower, a metro station, that is very clean, comfortable and has top service ... then give Hotel 7 Eiffel a call and book!

Reviews.Title: “bar closes early”
Reviews.Author: maennele
Reviews.Content: although the interior was not of our taste the rooms were fairly nice, very clean. However we were really disappointed that after having asked for a room with view of the eiffeltower (7eiffel??) we were told there's none but one could see it from the room terasse.... you can standing on one of the tables! also bars in this area close early at night and there is no way you can get anything to drink at the hotelbar after midnight, not even if you'd go for a bottle of champagne the reception will make an exception. Also the beds are very soft and the pillows&sheets plastic instead of feathers... for those who like it, ok, we found it cheap...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: themadplace
Reviews.Content: On Arrival at the hotel we were very cordially greeted, everything was explained in English. Our room was extremely well presented, small as you would expect in Paris, but very lovely. we did not make use of any of the facilities outside the room so cannot coment on those, but of what we saw, everything looked very good.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to stay at. A must for couples!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerB7
Reviews.Content: The first surprise I got when I arrived, I was told "you got upgraded"! A room with a balcony and more space was perfect to enjoy the trip to Paris.
