The location of the Hotel is fabulous, right in the middle of the city and close to both the Eiffel Tower and the metro station. The good part was that the lady at the reception desk was very helpful and tried her best to help us tourists get to different points of interest. While I booked a twin room to for myself and a visiting friend, I found the theme of the hotel to be more towards "couples" rather than solo travelers. Hence I recommend couples to visit this Hotel, where any couple will surely enjoy their time in this lovely hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Very modern with nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: cgiuliacci
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and had a sheek ambiance to it. The location was good (not great), being a quick 10 minute walk to either the Eiffel tower or the beggining of Champs Ellyses. The restaurants, cafes and bars around the hotel were pretty dead. I would give this hotel 3.5 starts if i could, but not quite four.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, nicely located”
Reviews.Author: MikeRea
Reviews.Content: Although I have no idea how one might see the Eiffel Tower from any room in this hotel, it is in a pleasant side street, away from main traffic, so good for a quiet night. Rooms were nicely decorated, if a little on the small side (we had two adjoining rooms, for our children 13, 15 and us). Spotlessly clean. Didn't take breakfast, as we thought â‚¬19 per person for continental breakfast to be on the high side, and used the bar less than we might (when we could find a barman - very hard when in the roof garden...) - at â‚¬8 per small bottle of beer, not sure we could have afforded more! The staff on reception were very helpful, and pleasant, and things like free WiFi were a real bonus.

Reviews.Title: “7 Eiffel Hotel is a GEM.”
Reviews.Author: Bella-Monahan
Reviews.Content: 7 Eiffel Hotel exceeded my expectations! The location & service were exceptional. The beds INCREDIBLY comfortable especially after longs day exploring Beautiful Paris. We included the Breakfast option was divine and delivered to our room every morning. They certainly have thought of everything!

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANT STAY IN PARIS”
Reviews.Author: Realsissy
Reviews.Content: I liked very much this hotel because of the kindness of the staff, the excellence of the service, the style...The room was very nice, bed very comfortable, maybe a little expensive but I know that is for the position of the hotel: 15 min. from Tour Eiffel and 2 min. from the nearest metro station and Les Invalides...There are some shops, restaurants, boulangeries...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel, very close to The Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Disneytrio
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from a 2 night stay in this lovely hotel. I took my husband for a suprise 40th birthday present and we loved it here. Its a 10 min walk to The Eiffel Tower and 5 mins from the hotel are lots of shops, supermarkets restaurants etc. The rooms are cosy and well equipped and beds and pillows are lovely and comfy. The staff are very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be central in Paris, its a hidden gem and is situated down a quiet road. If we return to Paris in the future we will stay here again with no hesitation, great place!

Reviews.Title: “Chic and urban. We loved it !!”
Reviews.Author: jortsdols
Reviews.Content: Nice and helpful service. Very clean, and loved all the small details. It has this incredible terrace at 5th floor which is perfect for a chill out time. The only problem was that Wi-fi connection poorly reached our room, although it was probably because we stayed in the furthest room from reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!top deco. Awsome terrasse.”
Reviews.Author: Gittejurgens
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms even though not so big. Super atmosphere with helpfull staff. Go and enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: EB1608
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel 7 Eiffel at the suggestion of a co-worker. The staff was very friendly and helpful (even with our limited French!) and the rooms, though compact, were well laid-out, modern and very functional. The bed was super comfy, which is always a plus! The location was excellent - 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and 5 minutes to the nearest Metro station; lots of small boutiques, cafÃ©s, etc., just around the corner. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Super Clean & Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Lisatini1013
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Paris in April with my 18 year old daughter. I chose this hotel based on all the positive Tripadvisor reviews and I was happy with my decision to stay here. Even my picky daughter enjoyed the hotel! I researched all hotel/travel websites and booked directly with the hotel because I found to be the best price and it included breakfast. Prior to our stay I sent several inquiries to the hotel regarding the room and restaurant recommendations. All emails were responded to promptly and in a friendly manner. The hotel is on a quiet street within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and many other must see sights and a short walk from a Metro stop. When we checked in, Manon the front desk receptionist, greeted us by name. Manon is super friendly, speaks English very well and she was very helpful during our stay. Our room was small and the shower is beyond tiny, but everything was impeccably clean! The decor is hip and trendy. The bed was very comfortable. There was not enough space in the room to store our luggage, but that was no big deal as the hotel offers a storage room near the lobby. Our room was on the top floor and I found the room to be extremely quiet. There is a cute roof top lounge area and the breakfast room is equally cute and spotless! The pictures you see from the hotel web site are spot on; what you see is what you get! Only problem; The free Wi-Fi has an option to save your room login. DO NOT check this option. If you are lazy like I was, and do use that option, BEWARE! Your email will be hacked and all your contacts will be sent spam emails! This was my 3rd trip to Paris. I must say this hotel has by far the friendliest staff I have experienced in Paris. Great base for a week of sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: youloveus81
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner could have had a better time at this hotel. The problem most hotels have is that the pictures on their brochure or website make the rooms look better than they actually are HOWEVER this hotel is really a cut above the rest. Our room was fantastic, the look and feel or the room was so good. The room service kept the room in spotless condition. We really could not of had a better time THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Megsalicious
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful and luxurious, Great Location Staff very helpfull and very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a short break.”
Reviews.Author: dulwichboy
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for somewhere well located, clean and remarkably good value I'd highly recommend 7 Eiffel. The rooms are pretty small but really cleverly designed to make the most of the space. I think it was only reopened after a refurbishment last year and it shows, everything is great condition. It's pretty modern / stylish so if you're looking for somewhere classical maybe look elsewhere, otherwise go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing 1st Visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: AndyB77
Reviews.Content: Hotel 7 Eiffel was an amazing find for us to head over for our 1st visit to Paris. Great location for us as we were not interested in being out very late in the evening etc. and it was close enough to anywhere you would want to go. Rooms are small but perfect. Beds are so comfortable! Staff were very helpful. The only minor issues we had was the WIFI being a bit poor (I would rather pay for one that worked all the time than have a free one that kept "dropping") and the air conditioning wasnt on yet (we spoke to reception and it was too early in the year...we just opened a window and it was fine!). These are very very minor points and we will defintely return to this hotel when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_S_79
Reviews.Content: This perfect little boutique hotel is located 10 min walk from the Eiffel tower and 5 min to Les Invalides. Rue Cler is just around the corner with it's genuine flower and cheese shops. It provides great service and gives more than fail value for your money. I'm returnig, that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LizzyinGermany
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Paris was to celebrate my 30th birthday, we booked the trip last minute and found this charming hotel on Trip Advisor based on other reviews. We have a 9 month old baby and needed to be within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, shopping and great restaurants. The location absolutely perfect, we never had to use our car once we parked for the weekend. The hotel is a hidden gem tucked away between two great shopping/eating streets. The hotel was very clean and very comfortable. The lady at the front desk knew exactly who we were upon arrival and took exceptional care of us to make sure we always had what we needed! We will definitely return to Paris and stay at this hotel! Loved every single minute!

Reviews.Title: “chic and charming hotel... highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: sterlingjulian
Reviews.Content: Thehotel was modern and chic and very pleasant to the eye. The spacious room was beautifully decorated, clean and elegant with a balcony. The service was excellent. The location was spot on, a 5minute walk from the Effiel Tower and lots of restaurants to choose from. I would highly recommend this hotel and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: cossie93
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my two teenage daughters for two nights in Feb. The hotel location was superb, less than 5 minutes from a metro station and only 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower. we stayed in two rooms under the hotels 'family' package. Both rooms were comfortable, well maintained and had obviously been recently refurbished to a very good standard. Although on the small side they were perfect for out purposes. My only criticism would be the hotels free WiFi...it was mainly non existent, I was only using it for my phone so wasn't really important but had I brought my laptop I think I would have been very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, only 1/2 mile away from Eiffel Tower, lots of great shops/bars/restaurants on the side streets!”
Reviews.Author: TonykingB2
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, small hotel room, air conditioner in room 204 did not work well but we were able to open our window and felt fine...it was great hearing the "sounds of Paris" as we drifted asleep and woke up in the mornings. Most of the staff speaks English and was very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “It is an excellent hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: oksiukovska
Reviews.Content: They have got the best mattresses in the world! I would love to stay there once more!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scootagal
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed in the Eiffel 7 Hotel - previously the Eiffel Park Hotel and found it to be even better than the last time. The rooms are lovely - some quite quirky details and furnishings that might not be everyone's taste - but the comfort and cleanliness are excellent meaning there's no reason to dislike this hotel! There is free wifi, free bottle of water in the room, free cup of tea or coffee in the bar each afternoon if you want, room service is available also. The beds are very comfortable and the showers are great. Rooms aren't massive but not tiny either - very well designed in all. The only downside is that the windows I believe are single glazed and you can hear a little bit of noise and a tiny draft - but not a major issue at all - just me being very fussy!! Would completely recommend this hotel as have stayed in many more expensive hotels that aren't as nice as this one!

Reviews.Title: “My place in Paris from now on”
Reviews.Author: rpolicicio
Reviews.Content: The pics at the website do not lie - the hotel is not big, but the rooms are new and modern (recently remodeled), not that small (considering Paris), very clean and nicely decorated. Very trendy: the design is also very nice, but the price is fair (we paid about 160 euros/night). Free wireless during all your stay. The staff was very helpful and nice during our entire stay. The bed was very confy, and the shower excellent (for us, 2 of the most important things in a hotel room). Good location near Tour Eifffel and the Seine, nice restaurants and very close to the subway. Considering it's a new hotel, and considering the excellent service, it's my choice in Paris from now on.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding experience of the 7th arrondisment”
Reviews.Author: max_uvarov
Reviews.Content: Wonderful design combined with a very nice location makes the hotel one of the best in Paris, I think. Very small, but well-organized, quite expensive, but comfortable. Breakfast is served personally in a traditional French style. Wi-fi is really hi-speed. Metro in a few minutes. The level of service is exceptional. The only drawback was the noise in the street and from the upper room - this was quite strange 'cause I hadn't found any noisy venues nearby.

Reviews.Title: “good value & great location in the 7th”
Reviews.Author: KLM11_11
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the 7Eiffel for a weekend break (4 girls) and it was just what we are looking for. While the rooms are very small (this is Paris after all), the bathrooms were spotless (although the water was not always piping hot) and the beds large and comfortable. We didnt have breakfast at the hotel and the lounge/bar area is pretty compact, in fairness it's designed for breakfast and not really for cocktails I think, and the area is full of small bistros and cafes anyway. All in all the service was excellent, the staff were always helpful and I would certainly recommend this small chic hotel in the 7th.

Reviews.Title: “As expected, great without bad surprises.”
Reviews.Author: Felippeluiz
Reviews.Content: Rom size is good, considering that we are talking about paris. Design of the Hotel itÂ´s great. The Staff itÂ´s very kind and helpfull. No need to speak french at all. Location is the best! Besides the touristc points, there are a lot of "Cafes", restaurants and stores nearby. I really enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Srogg999
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location- very close to metro line. Around the corner from various key sites in Paris. The area is not littered with cafe after cafe but it is in a nice neighbourhood and more suburbian which suited us perfectly. Service was excellent and staff very helpful. Everyone spoke very good English. Room was good with a trendy touch. Windows are single glazed but it wasn't too noisy. Room was an average size for Paris hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: ALP86
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through google for a 2010 January weekend. Their website has some good early booking (booked in early December) options which allowed us to get the most basic 'City' room for around Â£110/night. Its worth doing this if possible as the normal rates for such rooms can be as much as Â£180. This reduced price allows the hotel to compete with several in the area and allows the traveller to get a far higher standard room for their money. The room itself was spotless and perfect for two on a romantic weekend. Although small its easily enough for a short stay (its worth noting that the bigger, more expensive rooms are not really much bigger) and are filled with little luxuries to aid your stay. My one criticism of the room would be the lack of a proper toilet door which leaves a large gap onto the eye-line of the bed in the most inconvenient place. So best only stay with people you like. The decor is 'vivid' in the lobby and probably not to everyone's taste but its toned down enough in the rooms not to be a problem. There is the usual TV, kettle, free safe, toiletries, Air-con (although ours did not work), phone, wi-fi (not the fastest but enough for light surfing) and even his and hers bath robes. Its also in a very nice area full of good restaurants, street markets, 5 mins from metro and about 10 from the Eiffel Tower. Would strongly recommend it for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DansanScotland
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - quite unique! Great location near metro stop and many good cafes/ restaurants. Hotel was extremely quiet, clean and the beds were the most comfortable ones I have ever slept in! Prices looked expensive but having booked online, I had a much cheaper rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: GregAndLesa
Reviews.Content: My GF booked this hotel for us for a stay in Paris. We were only in town for a few days and we wanted to be close to the Eiffel Tower. Not only were we close to the tower we were also very close to a ton of great restaurants, cafes, stores, etc. It was very easy to get food or drinks at all hours of the night. It is a def a more touristy area, but we wanted that as we had never been to Paris, and as Americans, we are very used to convenience. :) The hotel was very close and easy to find from the Metro stop. The hotel staff were very nice and welcoming when we arrived at the hotel. Our room was as expected. Clean, comfortable, and relaxing. Be warned, the room is very small, we stayed in a Double, but we are very used to a boutique style hotel, so we knew what to expect. We actually were stuck in Paris, for a few extra days because of the snow storm and came back to the hotel. We were able to book a Christmas special that included Breakfast. The Breakfast if its included with the room is highly recommended. It was a basket of breads, fresh coffee, a beautiful fruit salad, jar of yogurt, butter, preserves, etc. Great way to start the day! My only complaint would be about the Room Service. The Room Service was said to run until 1:30 am. I went down to the desk around 11:30-12 midnight and he told me that most of the items could not be ordered. They do not have a kitchen in the hotel, they order off-site, so if you want food late, its going to be a crap shoot. We are planning a trip back to Paris in July, and we are definitely going to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great chique little place. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: canadamoon
Reviews.Content: Great friendly knowledgeable staff, very new and hip little rooms, free internet, and in a great location near the metro and 20-30 mins walk to the Eiffel tower. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: raqz89
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the 7 Eiffel for one night as i stayed in Paris for a short time. The hotel decor is beautiful and the staff were very friendly speaking both french and English. The Hotel's in a prime location just a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. the hotel is surrounded by loads of shops and restaurants. it's a lovely place to stay in if your staying in Paris 4 the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Bearcat01
Reviews.Content: This hotel, is placed within 10 mins walk from the Eiffel Tower, has been refurbished 6 months ago and it does look stunning. It's style is unique and the rooms are very nicely furnished and originally decorated. The bathrooms / showers are equipped with the latest fanciest kit, and they look really like 5star style. The beds are very comfortable and soft, and the decorations are really nice. The entrance hall has designer's style chairs and very nice atmosphere, the lounge and breakfast area are very well furnished and decorated. The staff are kind and very helpful. The breakfast, although not cheap, is worth the money. We already decided to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to the Eiffel Tower and Invalides”
Reviews.Author: MikeC47
Reviews.Content: What a great experience! The hotel is relatively small and so does not attract the normal tourist (noisy) traffic. rue Amelie is not a main thoroughfare and so one is not woken with road traffic noises. The rooms are smallish but more than adequate, particularly for those on business or looking for a quiet getaway. The rooms are spotlessly clean and everything works as it should. The hotel is close to La Tour Maubourg Metro station (about 600m) and so all of Paris is within reach. A 10 min walk gets you to the Eiffel Tower and the other tourist spots in that area. The hotel has a breakfast room that serves a continental breakfast. Other meals need to be taken in one of the many restaurants, all within walking distance. I found the staff to be very pleasant, on the ball, eager to please and knowledgeable about the area. All in all a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: bspatlanta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location to reach all sites and to get a feel for the city itself. The staff could not be more accommodating and the room, though small, is very comfortable. Will definitely return to Paris and this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “nice location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hesham284
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice little hotel. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Location is good with only few minutes walk to the nearest tube station and short walk to the Eiffel tower. Breakfast was included in our offer and it's a big plus if you are on a budget in Paris where a cup of coffee and a croissant for 2 would coast you no less than Â£20. The hotel provides free Wi-Fi, which came very handy when I received an email telling us that the Eurostar is not running properly, the receptionist were very helpful with tips on how to rearrange my trip Cons: The rooms are really tiny

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Chic”
Reviews.Author: RotorRobot
Reviews.Content: A Very nice hotel that i would recommend to all friends and family, great walking distance to metro, bakeries and restaurants. If i went back to Paris, i would consider another stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, modern and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Rdici_Pilot
Reviews.Content: As clean a hotel as we've visited. RIght on top the Metro and RER. Walking distance to many major sights. Staff courteous and friendly: especially the bar. The only possible downsides are the rooms might not be the most navigable for larger people. The 3* only for value is relative. At the moment Paris is damned expensive full stop due to the weak Â£ against the â‚¬.

Reviews.Title: “Toppertje!”
Reviews.Author: SilvyFG
Reviews.Content: The bed is fantastic, good bathroom, rooms are functional and nicely refurbished in a modern/designer style. The staff is very friendly and service oriented, walking the extra mile with a smile (helping with luggage, keeping the bar open for us when all we had were 2 wines, searching for places for us to go to etc.) and even deducted the breakfast charge from our end-bill since we did not take any breakfast! (late sleep-ins in the 5* bed ;)) Well, I stayed in many hotels world wide but that never happened to me before. We both would come back again. Note that we had a good last-minute deal.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: kcannon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Eiffel Park for about a week and loved it for the great front desk and dining room service, plus the location. It's newly renovated and they seem to still have a few kinks to work out, however. We had to ask to have the soap and TP in our room restocked, after which they did stay on top of it. The room itself was quite nice and everything worked, but it was very warm and all we had on the bed was a heavy comforter, so we had to sleep with the window wide open to cool the room off and stay comfortable. Other than that, though, a very nice place with friendly, helpful staff. We'll definitely give it another try.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience except for the wifi”
Reviews.Author: shopgirl427
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, the room, and the staff. The only problem was the that the wifi didnt work on the first day and was very weak the other days. I needed to go to the lobby to check email.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Friendly People”
Reviews.Author: Kurtburm
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights, the hotel is small but a great place to stay. I would stay here again on my next trip as it's centrally located and it had the most comfortable bed at a hotel I've had in years and I travel for work 75% of the year. Hat's off to the Hotel Eiffel park Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great staff, tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: shaunajill
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we were informed that the boiler was out of commission and would be repaired in a day... then two... then three. They offered us a discount on the room as well as a free breakfast of coffee, juice and bread. The room was very modern but very very small. The location is perfect for walking around a safe neighborhood for shopping and great restaurants. The front desk was very helpful and accommodating and answered all of our questions politely and in English. It was unfortunate that we did not have hot water for 3 days... I would have loved a hot shower! If it had not been for that I would say the stay was great. It was something completely out of their control. You won't be disappointed if you choose this hotel. PS. The rooftop terrace was fantastic... do not miss this if you stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location & Perfect Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roxysungirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 2 nights and were very happy with the location of this hotel, the modern decor and comfortable room. The garden terrace was great too. The rooms are average for Europe. The only thing that wasn't great was the shower was raised above the level of the bathroom, with a gap under the door, so the room was flooded everytime we took a shower. We had to dam it up with towels, but that didn't stop us from enjoying our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have picked a better hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ParisPauline32655
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect and within minutes from Rue de la Cler market with lots of really good restaurants and more. In particular, Tribeca was a great restaurant with reasonable prices and delicious food! The bakeries around the corner from the hotel had great goodies as well and some nice boutique shops. The Metro was only two short blocks from the hotel. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful. Also great was free access to their computer which enabled me to stay in contact with my daughter and friends in USA. The room was a bit small but then I was only one person.....don't think a Citi room is advisable for two people. My room was quiet but next time I would try to get one facing the other side as I did hear some street noise from my room but not enough to disturb me.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect place to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Juniora77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 days at the hotel, and we couldn't be happier. The room was very nice, the location is incredible and the service was great. People on the front desk is always willing to help you to make your trip as good as possible, I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: dazzle482000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights as a suprise for my Wife and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. From the entrance to the roof terrace, the hotel is tastefully decorated and modern in style. The staff are very friendly, and fully conversant in English, which is a good thing for people like me!! The rooms have been modernised and again decorated to a high standard, with a tiled shower and wash area just off the main bedroom. The roof terrace is a nice place to relax after a busy sightseeing day, the views aren't great from it but the comfort makes up for that. The breakfasts are quite big and enjoyable, and the breakfast bar staff are again very friendly and try to help you relax. The only thing I will add is that the hotel is a bit pricey if you don't book over the internet, but I suppose you get what you pay for. Location wise, it's perfect. Within walking distance to some of the attractions, eg Eiffel tower, Les Invalides, the Rodin museum and so on. If walking isn't your thing, the nearest Metro station is a 3 minute walk away with links all over Paris. I was impressed with the Metro as once you get used to it, the overal quickness of travel and waiting times have to be believed. Book for the Eiffel tower and the Louvre in advance as we did to avoid the massive queues. Finally, shop around when eating, the prices vary widely and a little walking can save you lots. Make use of the supermarkets as well. If I were to return to Paris, I would definately stay here again at the Hotel Eiffel Park, and I have just recommended it to a friend for his trip next month.

Reviews.Title: “We really loved it!”
Reviews.Author: camilagusmaomedeiros
Reviews.Content: It is a real fine place to stay, for its confort, beauty and delicious breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel i have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: sayersg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent in every way look no more book it. The rooms are very modern and the bathroom/wet room is amazing. The air con is very quiet and good. The roof terrace is the best part of the hotel on a clear/warm night it is very relaxing to sit there. The street is very quiet and lots of good restaurants in the streets around this area. Rue Cler is very close and has some great food shops. I will stay here if in Paris again you can walk to the Eiffel Tour and see the light show from a distance in a street around the corner, to walk to it in about 20mins. The Invaldes is also close and you can pick up the open top bus tour from both areas which are very good. The hotel rooms have a kettle which is very handy and we did use it as we did not take the breakfast as at 15 euro a bit too expensivie, use the local bakeries/cafes/supermarkets. The hotel reception is very polite and professional. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean, a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: jediyam
Reviews.Content: Located in the 7e arrondissement within walking distance of the Hotel des Invalides, Musee Rodin, Eiffel Tower and many other must-see Paris attractions. Rooms are very modern and clean, but the modern decor may be a bit of overkill for some. Room rates are a bit pricey, but I guess this is Paris after all. Check for offers with online hotel booking services for a better rate than the walk-in one. Breakfast is 12 Euro extra per person, but there is an excellent boulangerie/patisserie just behind the hotel so don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Was Amazing ,best location ,best staff ,best rooms”
Reviews.Author: niki05
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was amazing and we had great time there Best Staff , Best Service ,Best Location ,easy access to most attractive sightseeing in Paris just 2 minutes to Metro Station hotel was very new with new furniture and spacious rooms I recommend this hotel for anyone who wishes spend great holiday in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: archi10_10
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel for a couple. Modern, recently renovated, CLEAN, plenty of space (especially by European standards). Flat screen tv, mirrors, and queen (not double!) bed. The front of house staff was very personable and spoke good English. They had maps available and helped with restaurant recommendations, etc. In addition, the hotel is very close to a metro stop and near the Eiffel Tower. Great location as a spring board for site seeing the entire city of surrounding areas (Versailles, etc). Quiet aside from some street noise which is to be expected in a big city. A/C worked great.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic refurbished hotel”
Reviews.Author: dekandliz
Reviews.Content: really good to revisit this hotel after many visits.new owners have made a big impact in rooms,reception and rooftop terrace will look forward to another stay at this great hotel in the future

Reviews.Title: “Tres chic”
Reviews.Author: KatieFBirmingham
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel we were greeted by a very friendly and helpful receptionist, I wish she had been on duty more often. Our room was small but beautifully presented. Not a lot of privacy as the ensuite is only curtained from the bedroom, but travelling with my daughter, it was not a problem for us. Bed was lovely and comfortable and the room was serviced daily and lovely and clean. Not all of the staff were as welcoming as the first girl we met but certainly not rude or unhelpful. Breakfast was not included and was quite expensive, but then the whole area being so close to the Eiffel Tower was pricey. We ordered room service one evening and had a very long wait for a very expensive sandwich, food was ok but not worth the money or the wait and I wouldn't recommend that to anyone. The location was very good, only 10-15 mins stroll from the tower and only a 5 min stroll from the metro which was easy to use and allowed us to get around Paris quickley and easily. It was our first visit to the city and I would love to come back though this break did turn out rather expensive. If you are willing to spend a little more than just cheap economy break, this is ideal, but maybe not if cheak and cheerful is what you want.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: Phebejane
Reviews.Content: The best bits? - Fantastic location! A mere stroll from the Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides. You could also comfortably walk to Notre Dame,and the Champs Elysees from here as well. The Metro station (La Tour-Maubourg) and the the RER station (Pont de l'Alma - go here to get to Versailles!) are both very close. The L'Open Tour Bus also has 2 stops close by, at the Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides (a great way to see the city!) - Rooms look fantastic - contemporary - just like in the pictures. We only had a city double, and if anything it was a little tight, especially manouvering around the end of the bed. Would not be a problem if you didnt have to put your suitcase somewhere! (this is however a very minor issue). Housekeeping came in every day after we went out, and we came back to a very clean, fully stocked, pristine looking room each afternoon/evening. - THE BEDS AND PILLOWS ARE REALLLY COMFORTABLE! Maybe it was partially to do with how tired i was at the end of each day, but I slept like a baby! I would definately recommend staying here, but not if you're on a budget. We thoroughly enjoyed being so close to everything, and the assitance of the front desk staff (if somewhat reluctant at times). They also have a cute little roof terrace, but there is not much of a view to speak of (nor from your room might i add). Breakfast is available daily, but it only consists of a few different varieties of croissants, some fresh orange juice, and tea/coffee. We had breakfast here on our first morning but every other day we just grabbed it from the cute little bakery around the corner called Millet Jean on Rue St. Dominique (opposite starbucks). From here we also walked to Roger La Grenouille for dinner on our first night (fantastic!). They have free wifi available in the rooms but it's not the most reliable

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicJack
Reviews.Content: First time staying here, we got upgraded for no extra cost as soon as we got there. The room was very spacious and very clean. We were very happy with our room and the service was excellent! We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, but just around the corner of the hotel is a little bakery where we got our breakfast every morning. Its location is great. The eiffel tower is about 10 minute walk up the one street. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone and i would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable, quiet and very central located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Family-Hallmanns
Reviews.Content: We had booked a family room consisting of two adjacent rooms. We received two entrance cards as key for each room which is very handy with two teenage daughters. The rooms were newly refurbished in a very trendy and elegant way. The photo's at the website of the hotel are visualising the real situation. The rooms were very clean and contain next to the bed also a small table with two seats and a desk. The box-spring beds were very comfortable. The hotel is central located near the Eiffel tower and Hotel des Invalides. The car can be parked in the Vinci carparking Joffre park or Invalides. We paid infront resulting in a cheaper fare. Both parkings are within walking distance of the hotel. Overall a hotel which can be recommended for a comfortable and nice stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay, very nice design and service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: dePoorter
Reviews.Content: We experienced the service as very friendly and professional. Service with a smile from a competent staff. The room was a real surprise, we saw pictures of the rooms on the internet before our trip but to see the design room live was a satisfying experience. The size of the room and the king size bed was perfect, also very clean and nice temperature thanks to the airco. The room also has a free to use safe locker, minibar, free wifi-internet and LCD TV. We wanted to stay in a Hotel near the Eiffel Tower and hotel 7 Eiffel is only a 10 minute walk so we were happy! It is in a small side street where there's not too much traffic or other noise what makes it easy to fall asleep. What we liked best was the staff an the nice design of the hotel, we certainly will come back. We can't think of anythink we liked least because even the least would still be good ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great location”
Reviews.Author: Barbn34
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful--very modern. Hotel staff is friendly;and speak English well. No bathtub if that matters, and there is no door on the bathroom. Close to metro, Eiffel Tower, and the charming Rue Cler. My only complaint is that I twice asked for wake-up calls when I needed to either catch a train or a flight, and never received either. Fortunately, my BlackBerry did the trick.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to Eiffel Tower!”
Reviews.Author: family95070
Reviews.Content: The location is great! While there isn't a view of the Eiffel Tower it's only a 10 minute walk away. The hotel is very clean, nicely furnished, and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. I will stay here again when visiting Paris!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: murthyswindon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for two nights. It was a really wonderful experience. I will definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “MY SHORT STAY AT YOUR HOTEL WAS FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: babastravel
Reviews.Content: I came to stay last year in Dec2009.The diffrence was innense. The refurbishments a major difference. It was beautifull, family enjoyed their stay ,services provided were excelent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler09NewYork
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at Hotel Eiffel Park. Beautifully renovated, comfortable, quiet and spacious room. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Location, near the Eiffel Tower, is very convenient and pleasant. I will definitely return to the Hotel Eiffel Park my next stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “What a find !!!”
Reviews.Author: pchingu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband. Perfect location for sightseeing and dining. Small room but has everything you need during your stay, even hot water pot for your morning coffee or tea! Friendly & helpful staff. Loved the decor,especially the cobblestone carpetand bright colors! (Austin Powers anyone??) Very quiet area and many options for food and drink to chose from! (Rue St. Dominic) Many bakeries nearby for traditional baggets and croisants! Literally in the shadow of the Eiffel Tower and walking distance to many of the tourist attractions. Less than 5 min walk from Metro #8 line, La Tour Maubourg stop, up Rue Grenelle and right on Amelie. So convenient!!!! Try Bar du Central for a night cap after a long day of sightseeing. Right around the corner from the hotel on Rue St. Dominc. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The best stay I ever had!”
Reviews.Author: KaiserSrba
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying WHAT AN AMAZING STAY!!! The hotel is located in central Paris and is 900 meters away from the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is newly renovated and has a modern spark to it...which I just loved! My husband and I had suite 108 and was just perfect for the two of us. Before we had left we were considering upgrating to a bigger room as it was our honeymoon but I am so glad we didn't. These smaller rooms in my opinion are more for couples are there is not door to the bathroom, it is all open concept with a curtain you can use to make it more private. We presonally didn't mind because we are married so I thought it was cute. If I really had to say something bad I would say that it is not the best place to stay for individuals that are on business. The reason why I say that is because the internet access was not all that great. Sometimes we had access, sometimes we did not. Although there is a computer in the lobby that can be used. But remember, keyboards in France are a bit different than in most parts of the world so it takes a bit of getting used to. Also, the irons in the hotel are not that great. We tried ironing some clothes and it was just pointless. But those are all such minor things compared to all the benefits you get! I was even shocked that they had a professional blowdryer!! This is the first time I had been to a hotel that had one of these. I actually had brought my own becasue I was worried the one in the hotel would not be stronge enough. I would say that this is a 41/2 star hotel with 3 star pricing!! At least we got an amazing deal for $140/night. One more thing I have to mention is that our bed was very comfy!! We had a TV in our room that had English channels and I loved all the mirrors that made the room look much bigger...I could go on and on about our stay:). It is walking distance from the Louvre, Notre Dame, Arc de Triomphe, Eifell Tower, and many many more touristic attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel with great staff in a beautiful nighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: fuzzywuzzyworm
Reviews.Content: It was a little difficult to find the hotel, it is on a nice quiet street. The front desk staff was very helpful. We needed 4 rooms and they were able to get them all on the same floor for us which was great. The staff recocommended restaurants and helped with taxis, printing tickets, etc. It was nice to be in a quiet area with grocery stores, restaurants, cafes and even a laundromat nearby. The location of the hotel is great. It is close to the metro and bus service but really everything is walkable. We walked to the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre, and the Arc de Triomphe with kids aged 14-7. The hotel has been recently renovated and the rroms are modern and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location, Clean and modern, Helpful and efficient reception staff,”
Reviews.Author: CS&CLincoln
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights â€“ First trip to Paris. Hotel in very good location and in walking distance for Eiffel Tower, river and other attractions. Metro close by. Lots of good local bistros and restaurants although a little on the expensive side but this is the centre of Paris. Also watch the cost of drinks in the bar at the hotel, Very expensive (16 euros for two small beers). Tip â€“ Use the local supermarket for cheap beer / wine and then use the Hotel sunroof, which is very pleasant during the evening. Would defiantly return and recommend this hotel. Staff very helpful and pleasant. Love Paris a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern and flash.”
Reviews.Author: sashahitchcock
Reviews.Content: Unfortunatly the hotel wasn't marked very well on the street and us, like many other couples looking for the place went to the wrong hotel! However, when we finally reached the hotel we were pleasently surprised. Unlike what is marked on expedia this hotel is a 4 star instead of a 3 star so it was very good value for money at for the dates we chose. The street its located on is a nice quiet side street located near a few cafes and a convenient, and cheap!, supermarket which we found to be a much cheaper option than having the hotel breakfast. Its about a 10-15 minute walk from the main station 'Invalides' which offers alot of the main lines and good connections. The room itself was lovely, clean and air-conditioned! It was a little on the small side but that must be expected with Parisian hotels. The bed was very comfortable and a great size! The only down side is that the toilet door is not very secure and you can hear alot when your partner is in there. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful but we would have liked to have been helped with lifting our cases into the storage room. Overall this was a very lovely trip though and I would definitely recommend this hotel as it was great value for money and a lovely place to come back to after a long, hot day of walking!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience, we are going back!”
Reviews.Author: Kitsgirl26
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel for our honeymoon a few months back and was pleasantly surprised when we arrived to find the hotel exactly as pictured. We had a few issues finding it(mostly due to our own navigational skills), we turned the wrong direction out of the subway but quickly realized our mistake and got to the hotel. We were greeted by a very pleasant women (who I can't remember her name), she quickly got us checked in and on our way to our room. We were headed to a concert and mentioned to the lovely girl at the front desk, she said she would take care of it and to stop by on our way out. After a quick shower we were back out the door, and there waiting for us was not only a map of Paris but also very detailed map print out of our transit routing to the concert in the 19th er. This level of service we frequently found at the hotel, we were always greeted with a smile and greeting asking how our stay was going. On our last night we inquired with a young gentleman (again forgot his name, must be the wine we drank!), and he pointed us in a direction of one of the best dinners we have had in France called Chez Francois. It was totally hidden (so we would not have discovered it on our own), but had a live Big Band Style of music like we were straight out of the 1940's playing throughout the night. It was fantastic! Our only negative of our stay would be that we found that some of the bathroom amenities were not always replenished, but it was easy to find a housekeeper to do so. Our favourite aspects of the hotels were the rooftop patio where we had baguette, pate/cheese and a bottle of wine in the late afternoon sun, we always seemed to be the only ones up there. Also for those looking for an North American style shower, it has a huge rain shower head with good water pressure. Just a note that the rooms are 'cozy' but you are not in there very much. The general neighbourhood is fantastic and really easy to get just about anywhere in Paris. We had originally booked at another hotel in Paris for the night before we fly home, but changed and are now returning to the Hotel Eiffel Park!

Reviews.Title: “WOULD NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE”
Reviews.Author: desert76
Reviews.Content: Personal items were stolen by hotel cleaning staff from the safety of our room, when we reported it to the receptionist Nazrine (who gets a special mention as we have never met anyone so rude) she did absolutely nothing. We had to locate the manager ourselves as the receptionist refused to ring him and denied that he was in the hotel. The assistant manager promised to investigate the matter. After checking out he refused take our calls and the hotel refused to take responsibility for the stolen items. We were also woken at 7am by a fire alarm, had to evacuate the rooms, no fire and no apology from staff. I have never had such an unpleasant stay in a hotel or met with such bad unprofessional service and WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible support from reception; incredibly non apologetic”
Reviews.Author: GuptaTraveller
Reviews.Content: Landed at Paris ORLY airport and took at cab to the hotel. The driver did not know english, was rude and did not turn on the AC inspite of our request. Came to the hotel around 1 pm to find that none of our 2 rooms were ready. This is after I had prerequested early check in at the time of reserving the rooms. We got one of the rooms after 20 mins. But did not get another room till we left for sight seeing. We got the 2nd room late in the evening when we returned. Then the drama started. One of the rooms had a recurring problem (in the WC) of lights going off automatically and coming back at will. My wife called the reception and the person told her that he could not do anything. He is alone in the reception and can not leave the place unattended. My wife asked him what she could do next to get the problem fixed. He just did not know what to do and probably did nothing. We managed somehow. By 10 pm, one of the rooms became stuffy and we figured that the AC was not working. The reception again responded with "can't do much at this time" response. I went down to the reception and then this person (his name is Gildas) came up to our rooms. He tried to spent sometime but could not fix the issue. After about an hour, we figured that the AC in our 2nd room was also not working. We were in Paris for 1 night only and could not enjoy at all because of no sleep. We also booked Lido show for 11:30 pm on 9th June but could not go there because of all these problems. We opened the windows of both room to spend the night somehow. We asked Gildas to give us other rooms but he denied the same. He told me that there were no more rooms while I did see another guest checking in around 10:30 pm on 9th June. We got a brief sleep and woke up at 6:30 am to find that the ACs in both rooms working. I went down to the reception and got to understand that the AC started working in the morning only. I told the people at the reception of the horrid experience. There was no effort to apologize instead a lady walked up to my rooms and said â€œits workingâ€�, â€œits workingâ€�. As if she was trying to imply there was no problem. I canâ€™t comment to that as I was not contesting the fact that they were working in the morning. I was trying to tell her that the ACs did not work for the whole night. Anyway, I thought at the time of checkout they would show some concern and give me some discount. Nothing was apparently coming from the reception people at the time of checkout and I ultimately asked â€œHow about some discount atleastâ€�? Well all they did was to leave 24 Euros out of total 298 Euros they billed me for the 2 rooms with breakfast. The hotel had charged Euros 250 at the time of reserving and only 48 euros were to be paid more during the stay. I was so sick of the whole thing that I just left after paying 24 euros more. Honestly I feel cheated in the end. Ideally I should get atleast half of my money back. I will just suggest everybody to stay away from this hotel. We have travelled internationally a lot but have never stayed in a hotel who does not know what to do to fix its problems.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but the rudest, most offensive reception ever!”
Reviews.Author: comonaut2
Reviews.Content: No greeting or smile; made to wait at reception, then clerk insisted publicly that we had booked twice--incorrect! He said he didn't care what we believed, that he was working only in the interest of the hotel. Spoiled our first few days!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great location.”
Reviews.Author: yourboylc
Reviews.Content: This is a superb hotel, from the moment me and my girlfriend arrived to the moment we left, we enjoyed every minute. The rooms are decorated beautifully, the bed is extremely comfy and the shower / bath is a great size. The location is spot on, I couldn't of wished for anywhere else. Next time I go back to Paris i'll stay here. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: RelativeWay
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The breakfast was wonderful and it was really close to the Eiffel Tower! The room was clean and quiet. Another plus was that they have a computer with internet access in their comfortable lobby. Only negative was that it was a little far from the closest metro station (10-15 min walk or so), but I would still not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a home base”
Reviews.Author: CR1108
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Eiffel Park for 4 nights. It is a very modern and clean boutique hotel. Many of the rooms are newly renovated. The bed was very comfy, as were the pillows. There was a coffee machine in the room which was a welcome touch for our early morning rising. We noticed, like another reviewer, that the shower water tends to leak onto the floor. I think that is more of a miscalculation in the renovation. It looks nice, but functions less that perfect. But it is such a slight thing, that we just put towels on the floor to soak up the extra water. Location is EXCELLENT. Situated on a quiet side street we were able to get sleep and yet still get the Paris street feel. The neighborhood is safe and well lit. The Rue Cler is up a few blocks (fresh fruits, pastries and cafes to choose from), the Eiffel Tower was a 5-10 minute walk, there is a Metro stop (La Tour Mabourg) a few blocks up. On the side street are at least 4 cafes (from a petite dejuner to a full meal), a few pastry shops and two wine shops. There are also restaurants on the walk to La Tour Mabourg metro stop. If you make it to Paris take a walk to the Eiffel Tower, cross the street, walk down the stairs and get on the Batobus. It is a hop on-hop off taxi boat that stops all along the Seine. It is a pleasant and time saving method to seeing as much of Paris as you possibly can. Also,the staff at the Hotel Eiffel Park were very helpful and friendly. They spoke English very well, which just made things easier. Our stay went without a hitch and we would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Stay, good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: romeriboell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. It is a great area to stay. Good restaurants and boulangeries nearby, and it is very close to the Eiffel tower. The hotel is nice, were very happy with the good size room and it is very comfortable. For sure it is a lovely convenient location and good hotel. Would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Having a few problems with Hotel Eiffel Park”
Reviews.Author: Greysdog
Reviews.Content: Booked directly with the hotel. Checked in on Sat and were informed that the lift was out of order. Desk said it just broke down that day and they are working on it. So the front desk shows us to the stairs (which are open to the outside air). No help with the luggage is offered. In the morning we order the 12 Euro breakfast. My son got the granola cereal and found bugs crawling in it. They are sorry, but no offer of dropping the charge. At 9AM there was hammering and sawing on our floor. Now it is Monday and still no working lift. To be fair, the location is good and the room is newly redone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: CanuckHorn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Christmas week. Found a good family deal for two rooms on their website. The hotel is undergoing construction - appears they are redoing two floors. I suspect once the remodeling is done the room rates will go up. We loved the location, and the staff. The breakfast was good, and we enjoyed sitting by the fire in the evening and having some drinks. We found the computer with Internet access to be a life saver. The hotel is on a quiet little street with a couple of restaurants, an antique shop, a dog clothes shop and a laundromat. Within a short walk are more restaurants, grocery stores, pastry shops etc.. We really enjoyed the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Scuba_Kim_8
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quiet street and to be near the Eiffel Tower, this is a great hotel. The only complaint we had was with the booking process. I had booked a double and triple room months in advance and 3 weeks prior to arrival, the hotel called to say they overbooked and they would have to charge me for an additional room. It took several arguments and e-mails to correct the problem. The rooms are clean and the bathrooms in the superior room is spacious. Breakfast is a bit pricy at 15 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelingspartan08
Reviews.Content: The rooms and bathroom were clean and adequate, even if small. My main complaint was that the room was so hot and stuffy that it was hard to sleep, even with the window cracked open. We tried turning the radiator off but nothing seemed to work. Staff was very friendly and helpful and made you feel welcome. We had a tea in the lounge/bar area which was quite trendy in decor and comfortable. The hotel is on a quiet street in a great location near many markets, shops, bakeries, and cheese shops. It's a 2 minute walk to the Rue Cler which was our favorite place to get foods. There is a delicious crepe stand and pastry shop on that street that we returned to multiple times. It is also withing walking distance to many attractions. It is about a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower or Invalides, 20 minutes to the Louvre and Musee D'Orsay, 20-25 to the Arc di Triumph, and 25-30 to Notre Dame. We booked months in advance online on the hotel's website and got a very discounted rate which was a nice perk.

Reviews.Title: “Near enough yet far enough”
Reviews.Author: Love-Travel-Picture
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, all staff very pleasant. Room great size for two. Great location - near enough a tram stop to be near the centre, but far enough away to get away from the huslte and bustle. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mindloader
Reviews.Content: I'd say only one. I was extremely satisfied of the hotel and personnel I met there. Friendly people ready to help with everything. They made our stay in Paris wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet hotel, nearby everything;)”
Reviews.Author: yssemy
Reviews.Content: The hotel lies in a quiet street and the location is perfect. The staff was very nice and helpful. I would reccomend to ask the hotel staff for some help where to find things, because there are so many streets which leeds to same places. The only thing we missed was the famous french cheeses at the breakfast;)

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, good service, but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: citytripblog
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a fantastic neighbourhood, 10 min walk from the Tour Eiffel, 5 min from metro station La Tour-Maubourg (line 8), very friendly and safe. service was very good and the people at the hotel are friendly and helpful. rooms are clean, but very small and quite noisy (very, very thin walls!). breakfast was ok, nothing to write home about and with quite a limited choice. the worst part about it is the price (140 euro/night + 10 euro breakfast) as this is nowhere near the real value of the hotel (despite the very good location).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ADRIENNEParis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the Eiffel tower only a 10 min walk, so I would recomend taking a stroll in the evening to watch the light show. It is possible to walk pretty much anywhere and the neighbourhood is full of nice restaurants. It was both an eventful and relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: GrandRapidsMimi2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close to Eiffel, shopping, restaurants, other sites and bus stop. The street was quiet most of the time...noise increased during late hours as it got closer to the weekend. The room was clean, but in need of refurbishing. New carpet and bed linens would go a long way to making the stay more enjoyable. Room and bathroom are small, but very typical for European hotel. Continental breakfast was very nice. Service was good and staff was very helpful and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for Paris holiday”
Reviews.Author: Adel-Lad
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris, and we hard heard/read all the precautionary advice - expensive, tiny rooms, poor service etc. We were delighted with our choice - the hotel is well situated in a quiet and pleasant street; it's close to a metro stop; Eiffel Tower, River Seine and Les Invalides are all just an easy walk away; cafes, bars, restaurants, food stores and laundromat are only minutes away. During our stay all staff were courteous and helpful, and the front desk managers dealt with all our questions and requests - including where I could buy a spare camera battery when mine died unexpectedly. The manager rang specialist stores, and provided me with instructions on how to get to the recommended place. We also requested a kettle, corkscrew and other sundry stuff, and all requests were met cheerfully. That was good and much appreciated service. At the rates we paid it is unreasonable to expect a large room. Ours was not large, but had enough room to avoid the "stir crazy" syndrome experienced at some other places. Compared to the other hotels visited in France, Switzerland and Italy, it was good value for money. The bath was welcome after long days walking the streets of Paris. The rooftop "garden" with tables and chairs provided a pleasant place for a bottle of wine in the evening, even though the views are mainly of surrounding building. The free Wifi was welcome and reliable - something not to be taken for granted, even these days. During the 6 day stay we seem to have always got the "good staff" - no sign of the rude and unhelpful types mentioned in a minority of reviews. Or is it a case of "expectations realised"? Approach other guests and staff with good humour, courtesy and respect and you invariably receive the same response; expect a poor response and your expectation is often realised. This was our first experience of "French hospitality" and we were well pleased. Oh, when can we return to Paris - and to the Eiffel Park?

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, good value”
Reviews.Author: netsirk
Reviews.Content: we stayed here the first week of october for 3 nights. the lobby is warm and inviting and although the rooms are fairly basic it was very clean and had a little private balcony looking out on a quiet alley. the roof top terrace was wonderful - we took a bottle of wine up and enjoyed the private outdoor setting. we could not have asked for a better lcoation and walked everywhere in paris from here. and even with the current terrible exchange rate for US citizens, the price didn't break the bank. we would definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with typical Parisian rooms”
Reviews.Author: bonjourSydney
Reviews.Content: While small by our standards, by Parisian standards the rooms were a reasonable size and beautifully presented. The beds were comfortable and the quiet location helped us sleep off our jet lag. Our 2 children enjoyed having their own room and we enjoyed our privacy! A good internet deal for a family of 4. It was a great plus having internet access as it was one of the few places during our month European trip that had it. The location was handy to the Eiffel tower, with many Parisian food shops close by. The bar downstairs was open all day and we enjoyed our drink while we were waiting for our room. The staff were accommodating as they let us cloak our luggage on arrival and departure. This was the key reason we chose this hotel as our flight arrived very early on a Sunday morning. We appreciated being able to use the room at 1pm rather than later in the day. It was a memorable first night in Paris. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Eiffel Park Hotel - Great Location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: petehod
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight on a quick Eurostar visit. Simple fast check in, good standard Paris central room, small but great bed and shower. Nicely placed for The Eiffel Tower and surrounding area. Good breakfast included, overall a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Management, Terrible Cleaning Staff”
Reviews.Author: goldkold
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at the Eiffel Park hotel after reading the glowing reviews here and wish that I haven't. This hotel just has too many problems beginning with a very rude manager whose answer to any query is just a shrug, her attitude and surliness leave a lot to be desired . Also the cleaning staff rarely left the room clean as it should be and frequently forgot to replenish the amenities or change the towels. The reception and breakfast room staff were nice though. The rooms are small even by parisian standards and you can hear the street noise throughout the night even though the hotel is on a side street. For the same price, there are far better options in Paris and I'm surprised by the hotel's high rating. Skip it.

Reviews.Title: “very romantic area, and great location. but over priced, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: terrys57
Reviews.Content: book in advance, is my big tip. petite dejouner was very poor, and I got over charged on it with the final bill !!!!!!!! The breakfast lady was just down right rude to guests and gave very poor service for the cost of the hotel. Alan the conceriege was really great and polite and helpfull, but got told off for explaining things to me by his female boss!!!! the rooms are old, and need an up grade for the cost they charge. No parking even for motor bikes!!!!!, had to use another hotel's facilities for parking and internet.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel - fabulous location - great service!”
Reviews.Author: fdiva
Reviews.Content: My friend & I stayed at the Eiffel Park Hotel for two nights in September '09. Not being sure what to expect from a Best Western, was happily surprised by the sophisticated decor in the lobby/dining areas, and pleased with the charming room we had. Yes, the room was small, with two twin beds. But it was perfectly functional, had great WIFI service, and a great window with pretty draperies that opened out onto the Rue Amelie -- very picturesque with flower pots in front of the window. SERVICE was really helpful, front desk made copies of our passport for us for free, and in general, very helpful and professional. Super great neighborhood in the 7th arrondissement, so close to the Eiffel Tower and in a upper scale area with more boutiques and smaller stores (vs big huge chain stores, etc.). Highly recommend it. Got it for 398 euro for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: jonren
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 3 night stay at The Eiffel Park. It was a well placed hotel within a short walk of the Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides and the River Seine. Lots of little cafe-bar's, cake shop's and restaurants around the hotel that we used for breakfast each morning before heading off for the sights of Paris. The hotel itself was lovely. Our room was quiet, tastefully decorated and spotlessy clean, as was the rest of the hotel. What little we saw of the staff they were always friendly. The free tea/coffee making tray was a bonus, but you must remember to ask for it each day. The little roof-top terrace was a lovely place to sit and have morning coffee. A nice touch. All in all. A great "city break" hotel in a great spot. John & Karen Wrench Cheshire UK

Reviews.Title: “Eiffel Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Francophile-001
Reviews.Content: A pleasant small hotel, with friendly staff, in a nice quiet street in the 7th Arrondissement near the Rue Cler's famous market with a good selection of small shops, restaurants & brasseries locally.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: gothicgirl021
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful. The rooms were larger than expected. Only a ten minute walk from the eiffel tower. The toilet blocks quite easily but they fixed it right away. The breakfast is quite expensive if is not included (12 euro) The left luggage is quite good Overall very helpful staff, good price, clean large rooms. Highly reccommended. A lovely stay in a lovey hotel

Reviews.Title: “a welcoming hotel with light and airy accomodation and beautiful roof garden”
Reviews.Author: kabra53
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this hotel which provided a quiet, clean, comfortable and well appointed home from home within walking reach of all Paris has to offer. An unexpected surprise was the balcony attached to our room and the relaxing roof garden. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Eiffel Park Hotel - I wont stay anywhere else when I visit Paris”
Reviews.Author: waggaAussieinParis
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Eiffel Park Hotel. The first time we stayed here 3 years ago, it exceeded our expectations - thats why we came back, because we knew we wouldn't be disappointed. The first trip my husband and myself stayed. This recent trip my 13yr old daughter and myself stayed - she thought it was the most beautiful hotel she has ever stayed in - and we have stayed in quiet a few! The staff are friendly and helped us with information about taxis and entertainment bookings. They also speak and understand english. The quality of the accommodation is excellent. Very clean, very comfortable and very French - room decor is beautiful. The location of this Hotel is awesome. 10 minute walk to Eiffel Tower, through a beautiful cobblestone street full of cafes, fruit markets, pattiseries and restaurants. Would highly recommend this hotel, Australian travellers would not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive, but good location”
Reviews.Author: TurboDaan
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to everywhere. Don't be fooled by the pictures: * the rooms are outdated but clean * the roof terras has no nice view at all In summary, for 250 euros/night, i expect a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: kristianLondonderry
Reviews.Content: stayed in mid september for two nights. hotel was great. rooms were spotless and cleaned every day, towels changes etc. reception staff were very helpful and friendly even with our terrible french. location was ideal for site seeing. short but pleasant walk to eiffle tower. try and get there early cause the queues are long. and it took us nearly two hours to get up and down the tower. loads of shops and restuarants on your door step and along rue saint dominque. be warned that it is kind of pricey to eat out but its kind of expected in a big capital city full of tourists. loads of cafes too. i would recommend buying one of those hope on and off bus tour tickets. ideal for exploring the major sites. all in all a perfect weekend in a truly beautiful city. would definatley recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: johnsjam
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and found this hotel through TripAdvisor. The lobby is attractive, and we were served quite well by the receptionist/concierge. They have one person on duty at the desk at all times. We worked mostly with an Irish man who was quite helpful and friendly. He helped us with cabs and local travel. The rooms are small and basic, just enough room to maneuver around the bed essentially. The bathroom was nice, with a nice shower and facilities, though really lacking in places to put any of your toiletries. Also, the hair dryer was a leftover wall-mounted unit from an earlier era with a tube that blows air, and was marginally useful. We had two twin beds pushed together and they were comfortable. The room had a tv and AC. They offer a continental breakfast for 12 euros (pastries, cereal, coffee, tea, yogurt, fruit), but it did not seem a good value if four of us took advantage of it ($60USD?). There are several lovely bakeries and pastry shops around the corner, (as well as a grocery store)so we got fresh pastries for breakfast along with some Starbucks coffee (just around the corner also!). The metro stop is about 2 blocks away, and it is a pleasant walk to the Eiffel Tower, which can be seen frequently as you walk through the area. If you are after a clean, no frills hotel, this would fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect situated hotel in the heart of Paris 7e Arrondissement”
Reviews.Author: slbroekhof
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it is very convenient with public transportation: nearest metro line 8 station La Tour Maubourg and bus line 69 are only 3 minutes walking away. Other important infra-structures: lots of boulangeries, ATM machines, and Starbucks is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck! If There is Any Chance You Will Get the Room I Did.”
Reviews.Author: cookie43
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in an absolutely disgusting room, 102. It was dingy and old. There were padded wall papered walls that were grungy. The toilet rocked and banged when you sat on it. The pedestal sink was falling apart. You were afraid to look under the bed because something might be staring back at you. The blankets and bed cover were so gross, I put them in the closet. The pillows under the covers were yellowed. When I booked and prepaid this room it was both a Best Western and an Rive Gauche hotel. Now it is neither. So I didn't receive Best Western Points even though when they took my money it was a Best Western. One thing I have to be honest about was that I didn't complain while I was there. I had paid a low rate and prepaid. (Although I have had way better hotels in Paris paying that same rate) Also it wasn't until the second last day that I caught a glimpe of another room and realized there were better. My little girl had so much stuff around the room and was so tired by then, she didn't want to pack up to move rooms. Had I not paid in advance, I would have left after one night. When I checked out they never asked how my stay was.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for three stars, clean, friendly, helpful personal, good located.”
Reviews.Author: ErtRet
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited the hotel at the end of august 2009, for three nights. Small rooms, but clean, nice and warm interior, also in the rooms, air conditioned rooms. Personal very friendly and helpful, speaking english and spanish as well. The location of the hotel is great, 5 minutes to tour eiffel by walking, a lot of restaurants near by. I would choose the hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: mfleet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eiffel park hotel whilst in Paris for our 25th anniversary with family. The hotel upgraded out room to a four poster room with balcony. The room was a good size very clean and comfortable. The rooms the rest of the party had were a little smaller with no balcony but still very clean and comfortable. The location is at most a 20 min walk to the Eiffel Tower.The hotel is a . great location for links to the metro, tour buses ect. . Just around the corner from the hotel you have lots of restaurants, supermarkets and other stores.. Most of all the service from the staff was second to none. I would give this hotel a great recommendation and would stay again if I were in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsWorldLover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Eiffel Park Hotel and we both agreed that this hotel was wonderful. The staff was very helpful and the room was extremely quiet and clean (the bathroom was sparkling white). Please keep in mind that hotel rooms in Europe are very small so do not expect a huge room. We did not care about this since we only needed a comfortable, clean, quiet, air conditioned place to go to sleep at night and that's exactly what we got at this hotel. The Eiffel tower is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. We would head to it almost every evening to wait for the tower to get lit. So we would grab a blanket, a bottle of wine, a baguette and some fruit and we would have a picnic right by the tower. It was WONDERFUL! If you are thinking about staying here go for it, this is a great little hotel (only 5 floors) near major sights. Other tips & info: - Do not buy breakfast a the hotel instead go to a (delicious) bakery around the corner called La Boulangerie. -The hotel is located in the 7th arrondissement. -The hotel is walking distance to Les Invalides. - Train station in less than a block away. - Take the metro from the airport to the hotel, it is easy and cheap (we paid 8.50 Euros each as opposed to 50 Euros for a taxi). - Get wine from the supermarket located near Starbucks (sorry I forgot the name). - If you are fit, I recommend you get a map and walk everywhere instead of spending money on taxis or metro. We didn't spend a dime on either because we walked everywhere. - Eat in the Latin Quaters area. - It is very hard to get a cup of American coffee (Starbucks serves it but we didn't like it) so be prepared to drink a lot of expresso. We ended up loving it. - If the weather is good grab your breakfast and head to the hotel's rooftop, its a nice way to start the day. Do not hesitate to stay at this hotel, you will enjoy your stay at the Eiffel Park hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, cosy spot in a tranquil & quiet location, and walkable to major sights & the River Seine”
Reviews.Author: colinlokko
Reviews.Content: Lovely spot away from the hub-bub of crowds & city life, yet close to a few restaurants & pattiserie and the La Tour-Mabourg metro station. Easy access to the Louvre & St Germain area either by leisurely walk or short ride on the tube. Sophisticatedly decorated foyer, lounge & corridors and well-decorated room which all lend to a pleasant atmosphere. Luxurious Fragonard bathroom supplies, however staff need to be reminded to top up on daily supplies. Helpful & friendly service from staff who speak good English. Walk along the Rue de Dominique where you'll find the Eiffel Tower nestled between the shophouses - a 'secret' viewpoint of the Tower!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely helped make our trip to Paris that much more wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: phoenixMunich
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel far exceeded mine and my husband's expectations. From the moment that we arrived we were greeted by their friendly staff who, were always ready, available and happy to assist us with directions, questions and problems we may have had.( We did come down to the reception to tell them about a small problem with our bathroom, which they took care of immediately).
