The location is simply enviable - 5 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, 5 minute walk to Le Invalides, Le Pont Alexander, 10 minute walk to Place de la Concorde, 15-20 minutes to The Louvre - and 5 minute walk to nearest metro station in case you need to move around within the city. The rooms are not particularly big but are quite tastefully decorated, impeccably clean and wonderfully comfortable. I must say I was quite impressed with the staff's attention to detail in terms of cleanliness and our comfort. It's also worth mentioning that the hotel seems to have undergone a renovation not so long ago, as everything seemed so new. The beds were plush and comfortable, the bathrooms a little small but quite functional and very clean. This was my 5th time visiting Paris, and I cannot reccomend enough the value, comfort and friendliness of this lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: csmToronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and comfortable. The rooms are small and shelving/drawers are almost non-existant, however it is on a quiet street in a nice neighbourhood. Just around the corner is Rue Cler st. which is a walking street with many restaurants, bakeries, meat stores and a good crepe place. There is a small grocery store as well where we bought wine and other drinks to have in our bar fridge - red wine for 3 euros. The eiffel tower is a short walk away and there is a metro stop very close by. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous- we couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: eclipsethecat
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival at the hotel we realized that we made the best possible choice for staying in Paris! The staff was incredibly friendly and most importantly, the gentleman at the front desk spoke English, which most Parisians either couldn't or were not willing to do with us. We were staying at the hotel for a leg of our Honeymoon and upon arrival in our beautiful room (with the most comfortable bed of the entire trip,) we were greeted with a bottle of champagne and a note congratulating us. It was so thoughtful. We later took the bottle up on the rooftop terrace and shared it watching the sunset over the city. The hotel is literally a couple minutes from the Subway and a short 5 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. We would grab a baguette and bottle of wine and some cheese and go down to the Tower for Lunch. There are also many cute little bakeries with delicious treats right around the corner and super markets to buy bottled water at (a much better deal than buying it on the subway.) The bathroom was clean and spacious and came with toiletries and they even gave Kevin a bottle of shaving cream because he forgot his in London. Overall I was blown away and cant wait to go back. They were also nice enough to charge us in USD's while at the hotel which saved me from having to pay a foreign transaction fee on my credit card statement. Much appreciated. The air conditioning also worked great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice area and hotel was pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Canberra_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel which was well maintained and had attractive public areas. The staff were welcoming and always friendly and generally very helpful. Our "superior" room was small. I thought I'd pay the extra for space but got a huge bathroom instead. It was sparkling white with a bath and handheld shower. It could have done with a few more hooks and shelves. Our room (508) was on the top floor looking out to the street with only 3 others and was quiet as well as being adjacent to the pleasant roof terrace. The beds were comfortable. Breakfast downstairs was OK but the coffee was not hot and there were no croissants! So after the first day we tried different cafes in the area - there is a multitude of them especially around the corner in Rue Cler. There are also lots of restaurants for dinner and you can easily walk to the Seine which is only a block and a half away. The area was great for strolling at night and was close to the metro. The street is narrow and quiet although we kept our double glazed windows shut at night so we could have our air conditioning on. I think the hotel offered good value as I booked the lower, non refundable rate online via the hotel website. I also think it's well classified as a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: copperhead71
Reviews.Content: I travelled alone with my 18 year-old daughter and stayed in 2 different hotels in Paris, in different areas. This was definitely our favorite. I found the room to be decently sized. There's a/c and an elevator (can be rare at some of your Paris hotels). The bathroom was a decent size. The facilities overall were clean and well decorated. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Overall, I loved the location. We were just around the corner from Rue Cler which was great for dinner or picking up a few items for a picnic. The area is not heavily touristed like some others so we didn't have to deal with large crowds. And we were within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and a convenient metro stop for all other sights. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for siteseeing, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: v b
Reviews.Content: Just stopped at the Eiffel Park for 2 nights and overall was happy with the choice. The welcome we received upon arriving was very warm and the room itself was very modern. A bit on the small side but as we were only in Paris for 2 days it wasn't a problem. The Hotel is about 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower and there are plenty of restaurants in both the adjacent streets. The hotel does offer free wireless and also has a computer available for guest use, so that is a nice plus, only downside to this was that the wireless did not extend to the room we were in (108), one foot towards the lift and I could get a signal. Not a big issue though as you could simply pop downstairs and the signal strength was good. Our rate included Breakfast, which is your typical continental fayre, if you wanted something more substantial, like a fry-up, then you would be better going to one of the nearby cafe's. The only downside is the noise from the street at night, you could hear every footstep outside and when the crazy bike riders decided to ride their Overall - Very good, bit pricey but then i have since learnt that Paris is a v expensive city to be in

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: ADMarshall
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Eiffel Park Hotel for one night in July, 2009. The hotel is on a quiet street so you don't have a lot of road noise while you are trying to sleep. We arrived before our room was ready, but were allowed to store our bags in a secure room until our room was ready. Check in was very simple. The room was very, very clean and comfortable. Yes, it is small, but we did not mind. The bathroom was a nice size and had all of the amenities, except for washcloths, but we knew that so we had brought our own. Overall, it was a great stay and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay in a central location, walking distance to Eiffel Tower, metro, and local grocery store.”
Reviews.Author: ProfessinTraveler
Reviews.Content: The location is great in terms of walking distance to many sites including the Eiffel Tower, Louvre, and Musee D'Orsay. Even Notre Dame is not very far. The hotel is in the Rue Cler neighborhood -- it's filled with little shops, close to a grocery store and La Tour Mourbourg metro stop. The room itself is pretty basic and typical of French hotels. There is a hair dryer and kettle, along with pleasant mugs. The volume on the TV wasn't great -- it was very hard to hear some channels. Other than that, it's a decent place. The best part is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Recommending this hotel”
Reviews.Author: VassarJean
Reviews.Content: Like most of the other reviewers, this hotel worked well for us - it is a typical 2-star European hotel. We stayed at this hotel both before and after a river cruise into Normandy and saw 3 different rooms during our two stays. A couple of things about the hotel: if you ask for a 'double' room you get a smaller double bed, if you ask for a 'twin' room you get 2 twin beds pushed together that make up into a larger bed. There are 2 hand towels and 2 bath towels provided, so if you are accustomed to using washclothes then bring some old ones from home and discard them along the way. Two of the bathrooms had tubs with the typical half-glass partition instead of a shower curtain as most of us Americans are used to. The other room (207) had a shower stall with a very low shower head. Also, the travelers photos show a blue sign in front of the hotel - they now have a beige/brown sign (I don't believe that they are affiliated with Best Western any longer). There is a storage locker on the lower level if you need that on your first or last day - you take the elevator to -1 and push the bell and the person at the desk 'opens' the door for you - there was also an ironing board in this room. The breakfast was adequate, but if not 'included' in your room rate, then a little on the expensive side. At the end of rue Amelie on rue Dominique to the left about a block is a Starbucks and to the right about a block is Columbian Cafe. Rue Cler is also a block over. Please note that they do not allow you to bring food/coffee from outside sources up to your hotel room. Don't forget to check out the terrace on the 5th floor - a nice quiet place to get some fresh air after a busy day of sightseeing. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Dont' stay here!”
Reviews.Author: pcollinsLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst I've ever stayed at in Paris. Don't fall for the nice website or pretty photos. Staying at this hotel will ruin your stay as you deal with the incredibly rude staff, small dirty rooms, and so-called "double beds" which consist of two tiny single beds pushed together. The breakfast is a rip off too. Never, ever again!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: advisoryMalaysia
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel with excellent location in the heart of the city.Situated within easy reach to all the must see places in Paris. The room are clean and comfortable though small. The staff are just wonderful,- friendly, welcoming and helpful- to a non french speaking guest.Yes I would certainly return to this hotel the next time I am in Paris

Reviews.Title: “A friendly, clean, attractive home base for seeing Paris”
Reviews.Author: MovinAround53
Reviews.Content: My nephew and I spent nine nights at the Hotel Eiffel Park, having selected it from among many choices in a travel book and on-line recommendations. (I fret about whether I picked the "right" hotel for my preferences, and wonder if, upon arrival, I'll kick myself for not having chosen the "other one.") I couldn't have chosen better! Alain, Sanda, and Christophe at the front desk were flawless in their attentiveness. The room was clean and bright, with all the space we needed for preparations before our daily excursions and rest before our nightly excursions. The small outdoor patio on the upper level is a lovely place to sit and decompress. The hotel itself is on a quiet street, so sleep came easily. Yet it is one block south of St. Dominique and one block north of rue Grenelle where there are patisseries, boutiques, and other shops. We were only a few blocks from the pedestrian rue Cler, with several outdoor cafes, markets, and shops (cheese, wine, deli, and, importantly, crepes). The #69 bus is a few blocks north; it takes you to many stops along the Seine, including the Louvre and Musee d'Orsay. Only a few blocks east or west of the hotel are metro stops to take you anywhere in Paris. We were within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. There were many nearby grassy areas where men played traditional boules and younger men played soccer or rugby, or friends picnicked on blankets. All in all, an excellent location with a responsive, courteous staff, and a room pleasantly appointed for a fun stay! Touring recommendation: if you plan to visit several museums, even for only a few items in each, buy a museum pass. You recover your costs by the 4th or 5th museum, and you bypass lines. Also, buy a "carnet" of metro tickets: a set of 10 costs 25 percent less than if you bought them individually.

Reviews.Title: “For a Paris stay at this price, excellent hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: mmmgrant
Reviews.Content: Would stay here again. Great location, close to two metro stations, restaurants and shopping. Room clean and adequate size, friendly staff and all amenities we required. Got good price booking direct with them on internet.

Reviews.Title: “Our culinary, historical and most memorable holiday in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: alita51
Reviews.Content: My advice to travellers to Paris is never stop exploring! There is so much to see, I only wish I could have travelled to the outlying areas more as the trains are so efficient. We in North America are so very backwards in moving people in an effiicient manner. In regards to our accommodation, the Eiffel Park was everything we hoped for. Very clean room with everything we needed in it. Most friendly and helpful staff who suffered through our very poor French. The location is perfect with the Metro around the corner and Rue Cler one street over! We walked to the Eiffel Tower and to the Champs Elysees, the Arc du Triumph. My most memorable event was the Cathedral of Notre Dame. Truly awe inspiring. We had toured London the week before but this cathedral was so truly a church and the moment I walked in it felt very reverent, more than just a tourist attraction. I have no complaints regarding our stay at Eiffel Park. It could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi04NZ
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with close proximity to some lovely restaurants, bars and shopping/supermarkets. Would absolutely stay again and would recommend to anyone. The room was small, but clean and warm. Reception staff were very friendly and accommodating. Wireless broadband was fast and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place”
Reviews.Author: Finn64
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for the trip to Paris celebrating my wife's birthday, mainly because of its location - and to us it was perfect! We were welcomed to the room by a bottle of champagne, a nice gesture from the hotel. Our room was one of the five (?) on the fifth floor, not too big, except for the bathroom which was almost as big as the room itself! The room was cleaned every day. There is also a roof terrace where you can sit and enjoy the nice weather (no view though). We can highly recommend this hotel to any couple going to Paris on a romantic trip. There are plenty of nice cafÃ¨s, bistros and restaurants in the area, and close to a lot of the tourist attractions. We never tried the breakfast, as we opted for eating outside on one of the nice cafÃ¨s. The staff was very helpful, and assisted (amongst others) in arranging for a minibus to take us to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TottyMoto
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel such as: Check in: The reception is lovely, clean, professional looking, we arrived early but our room was ready, the person who checked us in was very welcoming and took time to explain things to us and show us the hotel amenties, such as free internet access, 24 hour bar, where the breakfast room is etc Room: Beautiful, very clean, the bathroom appeared quite new, enough room for clothes storage, tv with 9 channels - 2 in English, comfy bed, safe (you have to leave 50 Euro deposit for the key) It was cleaned every day and you get a little biscuit on your pillow Location: Fantastic, only 5 min walk (if that) to the nearest metro, literally 10 mins walk to Eiffel Tower, Hotel des Invalides or Rodin museum, maybe 30 mins walk to the Louvre. Lots of shops and cafes nearby. Also as it is not on a main road you wont get disturbedby noise from outside. Breakfast: Was 12 Euros per person, but for Paris this is good, ( when we went somewhere else on day we ended up paying 12 euros for 2 coffees!!) esp as it is buffet breakfast, and the breakfast room itself was lovely, or you can have it in your room for the same price. Staff: Everyone we encountered was very friendly and helpful with any questions we had. All in all a great hotel, especially for the price, I would definitely stay here again if i am ever lucky enough to find my self in Paris. Happy to answer any questions if i have not raved enough about the Eiffel Park hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for the money”
Reviews.Author: FraHar
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on the internet and not knowing the city of Paris and it's "districts" we really didn't know what we were getting. We were pleasantly surprised with this "quaint, boutique like" hotel. The breakfast is wonderful and well worth the 10 euros if booked with the room, if not, we paid 12 euros per person. There is a little bar in the hotel, no restaurant, but don't worry you only need to walk out the door and the street you are on has some wonderful restaurants. The hotel was recently renovated and we stayed in the Superior room with a double bed, desk, 2 chairs & table, TV, MiniBar and a balcony with table and 2 chairs. The superior room has its own ensuite....this was important for us. Decore was very "french". The staff was very helpful. Sanda at the front desk was helpful in assisting us with our 8 hour day trip of Paris. You absolutely have to take the "Paris Trip" guides...in the afternoon we had a minibus and driver to ourselves. Just perfect!! At every turn from the hotel you can see the Eiffel Tower! Enjoy, we did and will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: ardaxon
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, friendly host/hostesses. Always had a clean, pleasant room with a great view and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “The right place”
Reviews.Author: polaroyd5
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel in central Paris, with the purpose of visiting the city walking and not wasting time in daily trips from and to the hotel, and not too expensive! This one is perfect, very close to the Eiffel tower and Les Invalides, with a nearby metro station (La Tour-Mauburg). The neighbourhood can't be nicer. There are good and cheap restaurants in the same street (Rue AmÃ¨lie). Breakfasts are worthy enough (if you ask for them during the reservation, you'll get a 2â‚¬/person/day saving). I've been in 4 star hotels that are worse than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Visit Paris”
Reviews.Author: Geertjan
Reviews.Content: Pleasant small hotel in the centre of Paris. In a small street without too much traffic.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: biggerbelly
Reviews.Content: we stayed at thins hotel for one night. the hotle was better than we thought it would be. Just a short walk to the eiffel tower easy to find and very close to the subway. they have charming lobby. however it is much nicer than the rooms but they are adequate and roomy for europe. we could see the eiffel tower from our room on the 5th floor. considering the cost to stay in Paris this hotel including breakfast was 119 euro. We were very pleased. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, good location, poor staff”
Reviews.Author: SimonButler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my 8 year old son. The hotel was OK, not terrible but not amazing either. It is in a good location 10 mins walk from the Eiffel Tower and close to some lovely cafÃ©s, restaurants, boulangeries etc. I got a good deal and paid â‚¬95 a night for a twin room only. Breakfast was â‚¬12 per person so we ate at one of the close by cafÃ©s where breakfast was a more reasonable â‚¬6 pp. The free wi-fi was also a bonus. But the staff were not great. When we arrived we were booked into room 106 which was a double room. I had ordered a twin room as my son and I wanted separate beds so we got changed to room 104 which thankfully had twin beds. But the beds were joined together using a large bed spread - it wasn't a major issue to separate the beds but it would have been nice if that had been done before we got to the room. The lady from reception left us to do this. That first evening it was quite hot and humid in the room but there was no way of turning on the air con. There was a unit in the room but the control unit had been taken out. We were both already in bed by this stage so I dialled 9 to speak to reception but no one answered. So I put on jeans over my pyjamas and put on my shoes and went downstairs. Earlier in the evening when we came back from the Eiffel Tower I had seen the man at reception was on the phone. And when I went downstairs he was still on the phone - obviously talking to family or friends! - so this was why he hadn't answered my call. I asked him if it would be possible to turn on the air con and he said no., it was impossible. He helpfully suggested that I should open the window. So that is what I did and we had to put up with noise from the street. Admittedly it wasn't that noisy but 1 car a minute did drive past so my son was still disturbed. Plus it was a very still night and very little air came into the room to cool us down. So overall this is an OK hotel let down by unhelpful staff. But despite this we had a magical time in Paris and hope to return soon but not to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: august444
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 1y 9m old son were in Eiffel Par hotel for 4 nights. Perfect location - just 10 min walk to the Effel tower and 5 min walk to the Invalides. Little, clean hotel with very friendly staff :) Room was small, but it was ok, because we used our room just for sleep, all days we were walking in the city. Free WIFI was also very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect balance of location, service/facility quality and cost”
Reviews.Author: CTS07
Reviews.Content: This was 8 night stay in Paris was first for my sister and I. We did a lot of research to find good quality hotel in heart of Paris attractions, and we were not disappointed. The staff was great, the location convenient walking distance to everything we wanted to see or do. The room/bathroom were comfortable size, furnished well and cleaned daily. The hotel was very quiet, too. Our trip could not have been better!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel 7 Eiffel
HotelInfo.Address: 17 Bis Rue Amelie | 7th Arr., 75007 Paris, France
